reviewText:
Early Access Review

2500+ hours. Ran one of the top 10 servers in the world for Population. This is post is purely for feedback to the devs and those who wish to purchase the game.


Pros:

* Dinosaurs
* Fun survival aspects
* Several tiers of tech
* Nice scenery if you can afford a 4000$ gaming PC


Cons:

* 1) Constant bugs since release
* 2) Constant crashes in almost every aspect of gameplay (PVP is almost completely useless due to the crashing). Devs refuse to aknowledge or fix any of these bugs.
* 3) Mass forum bans from the moderators. No matter how innocent the post. the moderators will ban you over and over again (was once banned for politely asking another player not to plagiarize my server ad he stole word for word lol... Thanks for that moderators). The majority of the people posting on steam are banned for any and all reasons.
* 4) Worst ETAs i've ever seen. Patches are pushed back and back and back. Patches due to release on specific days are pushed back 14-20 times causing mass confusion and problems for server admins. People always argue that ETA are ETA. But the way to do ETA properly is to Figure out what you want to release in the patch, test it out, Then once it's ready and finalized give an ETA (will release patch at this time. And BE ON TIME!!!). the community, especially the admins will love you for it. I'd rather wait a day or two and have it release on time so i can update my server on time instead of staying up till 7 am in the morning to make sure my players can play.
* 5) Patches are NOT tested at all before release. Causing mass Wipes and critical bugs(swamp biome anyone? Invisible buildings anyone? lol).
* 6) Mass Hacking. No Anti Cheat what so ever.( yes it's coming. But it remains to be seen if it will actually work) Devs make a lot of false promises.
* 7) False promises. Devs promise one thing and never deliver. (1 of many examples; DirectX12)
* 8) Updates are almost always new dinos. there are 50+ dinos now. Most of them utterly useless. while it's great to have diversity, the map is overflooded with useless dinos. Make a bigger map of thin it out. No new tech, no diverse new gear(1 best gear for pvp, 1 best gear for cold..), no new game play. You can play the game for a week and get bored because of the lack of content.
* 9) Too easy to greif in the game. PVP has not been thought of very well. This gives admins a hell of a hard time upholding their rules.
* 10) Guns are Underpowered and unbalanced. A sniper does less damage then a pistol lol.
* 11) Major rendering issues. Have a base more then 6 tiles? Youll come within render distance and see EVERYTHING inside!
* 12) Dinos constantly disappear and vanish without a trace. Dino pathing is ridiculous! Needs a Major overhaul.
* 13) Developers RIP off mods, give the item a new name and claim credit for it(industrial forge? Industrial cooking pot?).
* 14)Developers are more obsessed on Hacking infested contests (survival of the fittest) and blowing away money to cheaters instead of focusing on the game.(this really pisses me off).
* 15)Coding needs alot of work server wise (people cannot find server on servers list, mod downloading issues etc).
* 16)Almost every single Admin command is corrupted and will glitch your game (force joining tribes, kill all wild dinos = crash etc).
* 17) Community is constantly ignored and treated like ♥♥♥♥ by the admins. Especially One Dev that starts with the letter N. I won't name him to not break any rules.
* 18) 2500$ gaming pc and Can't even run on full settings. Game is very poorly optimised.
* 19) It takes 30+ hours of non stop feeding to tame high level dinos and breed high levels dinos(officials).
* 20) Devs Repeatedly Add unbalanced dinos which ruin the entire game ( Godmode GIGAS that can destroy entire bases and 50+ dinos in 2-3 bites? WOW!)
* 21) Devs try to balance dinos by making them weaker then a ♥♥♥♥ing dodo bird?. Seriously? Absolutely no pre testing at all. Just another attempt at forcing players to grind for hours with Really weak dinos. this is not acceptable. Everyone has jobs, everyone has ♥♥♥♥ to do. Nobody can spend 10 hours grinding for 1 dino. That's not realistic. You're losing alot of good players because of this ideology. Grinding for hours doesn't mean skill.
* 22) Takes hours and hours and hours of hard grinding just to build a small base on official servers.
* 23) Several tiers of Tech is a good idea, but it was badly designed. Most people i know go from wood or stone to Metal because there is no point in the other tiers (waste of time).
* 24) Lack of community support regarding bugs. I've personally put in over 30 threads regarding issues which were all ignored by the dev team. Put a list of bugs you are currently aware of on a STICKY thread that way we know which to report and which not to.
* 25) build your base on a beach? Which 80% of the people do. Fresh spawns will almost always spawn inside your base.
* 26) Dinos falling through the world
* 27) Supply drops spawning above caves, or inside mountains.
* 28) Outdated supply drops for over 7 months. Supply drops are a big part of the game.


To Conclude. Ark is dying. It doesn't even have close to the same amount of POP we had 4-5 months ago. For example; only 3 out of the 200 people on my friendslist who used to play no longer play ARK. the most common reasons are 1) They cannot play due to the  bad optimization of the game 2) It's boring 3) Tired people greifing their hundred hours of grinding and hard work. In my personal opinion, everyone has moved on including the Devs. Devs have all but given up on the game now that they have raked in millions. The updates are slower and keep getting pushed back months after months after months. Promises made 5-6 months ago are pushed back till late August. Devs have made poor decisions regarding the way the game should have been built. Survival of the fittest? Great! Add that as a DLC or Free content after you've finished the core game. Instead of wasting weeks of development time on Dumb tournaments full of cheaters and corrupt players (Most of you know what i'm talking about). Further more, i appreciate that the devs release Q&A to the public. That's really good on your part. It's a step in the right direction. However,  i'm appalled at the moderators for mass banning people on forums, reddit forum etc. Calm down and Stop with the power trip. The community is here to voice their concerns. You can't og off banning people for no reason. Half the threads on steam are locked or banned because the devs don't want us talking about main issues (even those posting innocent comments get banned from people who abuse the report button a.k.a Spectre_06 Ertosi). The developers have made it very clear they do not give a ♥♥♥♥ about their community leaders. While ark is a fun game to play, it has too many problems and too many obstacles to overcome. The way that the population has been declining has proved this.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I apologize for the length of this, but i assure you, if you take the time to look through, you will see something very intresting. I am a customer of ark survival evolved, and have nearly 900 hours logged into the game now, however something happened earlier in the week on OfficialServer363 that makes me contemplate my choice in playing this game, and I want to make sure other to-be customers know exactly what they pay for when they are purchasing the game. So basically, our server was invaded by a group of chinese hackers, and we took numerous footage and sent it to the devs in any way we saw imaginable, and in the end, all that happened was a verbal warning given by the devs to turn of hacks, and nothing else. I am going to send you the links to our evidence, and even the devs response so you can see for yourself the injustice committed and so that hopefully you can spread the word so that maybe the devs will be forced to do their job.

Evidence: https://drive.google.com/drive/u/1/folders/0BxSn3VXgsurqTPNM1BzNHVlUjQzVGM   (On this drive, you will find various videos and screenshots of the hacking in action, and even at one point they openly admit to hacking in gen chat)

http://steamcommunity.com/app/346110/discussions/0/451850849193957194/

(This is a link to a steam discussion from people on our server, even those who werent in our tribe complaining about the hacks, and the lack of response from the devs, it was locked by nubsly, a dev, and was responded to by TheRightHand, another Dev, saying they will investigate further, but that hasnt happened, and I dont really see how any more proof, or investigation is required)

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=o8vWC8gPd4o      https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=K5dR6gDhoIA

(these youtube videos are us recording the chinese stream on http://www.huya.com/32386092and http://www.huya.com/heimo  you can clearly see the chinese esping, and accessing their hacking menu to enable aimbot, and even glitch under the map at one point)

http://postimg.org/image/g6w83z7ut/

In response, a moderator spawns a dragon and flies to their base, only to give them a mere verbal warning

Finally, we have attempted to share our story on reddit, and it was picking up steam and the youtube video was gaining increasing views and attention, however a moderator from https://www.reddit.com/r/playark/ ended up deleting the post.

Once again, I apologize for the length, but I encourage you to take a look at it as it shows a clear injustice done to us, a tribe who spent weeks gathering, farming, and taming, only to have it all taken away from us from a group of hackers who are to this moment unpunished for their cheating. We went through all the official channels, sending numerous emails and filling out multiple reports on surivetheark.com without any real response. The devs claim that they have 0 tolerance towards hacking and cheating, but they give the hackers a second chance? Well that is clearly not the case here.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

What's the point of persistence if you get destroyed every, single, night? You can't even move character to a PvE server unless the server you're on supports it (Official ones don't seem to have it enabled) so you have to start a whole new character again for each server, which means all those hours of grinding becomes completely pointless (Not even talking about inventory, even just levels/XP/engrams would be helpful). There needs to be a better balance between PvP and PvE that isn't so black and white and PvPvE servers and servers which don't allow transfers need to be better marked. Oh, and all those fancy technologies you see? Good luck getting those any time soon without grinding half your life away.

If you can spend copious amounts of time dedicating yourself to this game, work in a large tribe, only care about private/local servers or can transfer your character around to different compatible servers then you can negate these problems, otherwise, it's just like any other persistent survival creative open-world game on the market, in that your progress is consistently wiped away making it an excercise in masochism.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

TL;DR: Only buy this game if you don't need many FPS, love content updates, have friends to play with, much time, you can live with annoying bugs and rubber banding. No seriously. This game can be very frustrating but also very enjoyable. It clearly has potential but the developers are focusing too much on content updates and not on bug fixing / balancing / optimization. So you should probably wait for the release (apparently in June). I know it's in alpha but this doesn't change the following facts:

Pro:
+ content (many dinos, items, biomes)
+ standard map is big enough for many players
+ multiplayer
+ mod support
+ dedicated servers (free server software; also linux compatible!! :) )
+ good graphics (if you are able to run it on high and don't need many fps..)

Contra:
- very bad performance (!!)
- mostly content updates (optimization updates are postponed very often)
-> high hardware requirements (client and server)
- random crashes (client and server) -> can lead to rollbacks (very frustrating)
- unbalanced pvp / dinosaur stats
- dying because of fall damage can bug away your corpse
- many collision problems (corpses can desync)
- dinosaurs and players can get stuck easily in trees, stones and other dinos
-> dinosaur could be killed
- rubber banding problems (on every server I played on)
- buggy building mechanics/system
- strange preferred kibble order" (kibble is food for faster taming made of other dinos eggs)
- minimalist character customization
- bad dinosaur AI (terrible path finding)
- strange climate/temperature zones
- extremely grind-heavy
- dinosaur will lose gathering abilities when going to the coords 50|50
- dinos can attack you and your structures through walls
- you can glitch through walls/foundations when logged off
-> if your base is on water
date:
you'll drown
- bad lightning system
- taming and breeding system needs to be redesigned
- way too many dinos gather berries (very annoying when farming wood
hoursPlayed:
..)
- tamed creatures could walk through fences/walls when wandering
- BattlEye

Notes:
- Early Access

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Highly recommended! I picked this game up a few months ago and haven't been able to put it down since. If you enjoy survival games with tameable, rideable, dinosaurs, this is what you're looking for! Singleplayer can be challenging; be sure to adjust your server settings to fit your gameplay. If you want to level faster, gather resources faster, or be stronger then the dino's, set it up before you load up your game!

The point is to level up quick, find a nice spot to build your necessary items to gear up, then start taming to make life easier and more fun! There's special caves to visit to find artifacts, which can be used at one of the three Obelisks to summon... DUN DUN DUN the final boss of the area. It's really quite fun. Either Singleplayer or Multi, this game is really fun and addicting!

This game can also be taxing on PC's. I myself am using an 8 year old PC, but Ive tweaked it so I can play and enjoy the game fully.

It's all about the settings in-game, as well as running ARK with 'nomansky' or 'no sky effects' and 'low memory 4gb'. You can get both of these settings turned on at the same time by going to your

- Steam Library, right click ARK, go to Properties, General Tab, Launch Settings, and in your settings put -USEALLAVAILABLECORES -sm4 -d3d10 -nomansky

This will launch your game without sky effects and low memory settings. Now, for in-game settings.

In-game -
Set ground clutter to 0.
Set sky effects to 0.
Turn Resolution Scale all the way up.
Individual settings will be up to you and what your PC can personally handle. Like I said before, I have an 8 year old computer, so these are my settings -

Run in WINDOWEDFULLSCREEN [still looks full screen but runs with way less memory usage]
World Buffer - Low
View Distance - High
Anti-Alias- Medium
Post Processing - Low
Shadows - Low to Medium
Textures - High [If stutters are terrible, Medium]

Film Grain - Check
High Quality Materials - Check
High Quality VFX - Check
All others - UNCHECKED, unless you can run them [I sure can't without a massive stutter!]

Run your game. It should run fine, but not look super awesome sexy. I have videos of my ARK gameplay uploaded on my youtube channel. You can check these out and see if this is tolerable for ya!

https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCUriJJvdXjkWneOEzVh0A9Q

I hope this helped someone! Come enjoy ARK! I can't stop playing it! :D

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game could be the best game I ever played and certainly is the game I played the most in my life. Last few patches indicate thou that developers are not taking in account their players opinion at all. Specifically the last patch that nerfed all tamed dinos made them completely useless. This is now a game where you can tame dinos, but really don’t need to because you can’t even feed them and they are only OK for transportation.

There is an anecdote circling around that developers themselves don't have clue about their game because they needed to spawn compasses to find where they are in one of their videos. On the other hand someone who played the game since release knows every stone and every tree and can find a way home blind.

The game already had massive time sinks that could destroy your social life entirely, now its 80% worse because of the last nerf. Whole community forum is telling developers that they need to fix it but there’s no sign that they are aware of how many people they ♥♥♥♥♥♥ off. It used to be that if you put a lot of time in finding a good dino, tame it, and level it up, you were rewarded with faster harvesting, better pvp capabilities, and even partial safety. Now there is NO reward for your time investment at all!

Since yesterday, this game is only playable on a private server. And private servers just don’t cut it for hardcore players for reasons we all know.

14.1.2016 Edit:
They increased the resources gathering so that dinos now do get more resources than manual tools. The difference between tames remain too small to justify a lot of the game mechanics like cooking kibble for faster taming or breeding. They removed a damage multiplier for birds and made them OP again. Nobody I talked to understands why would they do that. It is a trend, they fix some things, they break some things. Majority of dinos remains useless and reward for player effort and knowledge of the game is too small.

17.2.2016 Edit:
Breeding remains unrewarding process, we'll see after the next update that is supposed to bring some new breeding features. Farming is kind of OK because the multipliers compensate for lost melee. Killing wild dinos still does not provide any real challenge, and the way dinos scale makes most of them not worth the tame. For pure DPS in PVE you would use giga and for PVP you would use mostly quetzals.

They did another major stupid change: they made not-mounted dinos immune to minigun turret on PVP servers which is the biggest fixed gun in the game. Someone wants to gun you down with this DPS monster, just dismount and your dino is in god mode, seems legit.

Last but not least, I am losing hope in this game ever performing better. When you have a lot of dinos and huge bases your FPS can go down to 5 6 even with the latest PC build. Outside of big bases you can enjoy the nature at 60, 70 FPS even more with certain settings, but once in the base, setting all to minimum, doing all online tricks and fixes, nothing will keep your FPS up if you have a mega base with 100s of dinos.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Having played a solid 20+ hours of ARK I think I have a good enough grasp on the game to give it a solid review which can explain everything you need to know about it.

ARK is a truly fantastic game, it's the survival game I have always wanted to have... It's a lot like Rust, like A LOT. It's got the same concepts for resource collection (e.g tree cutting for wood, mining rocks for stones and flint etc.) but it also has many differences as well.

Before the pros & cons list shows, I want you to know I have a decent computer system that can run this game no problem. The fault for low FPS is no fault of my systems, it is of the games lack of optimization. My hardware is listed below.

Processor: Intel core i5-4690k @3.50GHz
GPU: EVGA GTX 970 Superclocked ACX 2.0 4GB
RAM: Kingston HyperX 8gb Beast 2400MHz
Motherboard: ASUS Z97-P ATX

PROS:

- Graphically, it's gorgeous (currently very poorly optimized but it is #1 on their agenda to fix!)

- DINOSAURS!

- It feels like a true survival game, you have to keep an eye on everything that is going on. If you don't, you're f*cked.

- It's frightening as sh*t, night time especially. You do NOT want to travel at night without a friend or torch... trust me.

- Tribes! It's a great way to make groups with friends, currently a little buggy here and there but being worked on!

CONS:

- FPS Issues/Poor optimization: The game can at times be so laggy and jumpy that it is impossible to play and react to events that occur. For example, fighting a dinosaur at times can be a true pain because of the annoying framerate drops I get due to the lack of optimization in the game.

- The UI just feels super clunky and cheesy... It's just how the text is highlighted with glows and outlines really. It makes it feel an awful lot like a childs game where the text is made pretty and colourful and uses a crappy font just to keep your attention on it.

- NPC (dinosaur) behaviours are rather odd... Some dinosaurs seem to want to fight you for no reason, and others ignore you completely even when provoked. This is something that will be improved over time as a project this large isn't something that can be fixed and done in days or weeks, It takes months and years.

Honestly, this game is so worth buying. I can't recommend it enough... sure, it has its issues now but it's an early access title for god sake! What do you expect? Obviously the optimization and servers lacking places is an issue which will put people off, but in time it will improve! People really need to stop expecting these early access games to be polished and done upon release only to be disappointed and give it a bad review because of it.

ARK: Survival Evolved is a true joy to play, it's the survival game I have always wanted and now I can spend so many more of my days buildings a base with my tribe while we tame exotic dinosaurs and hunt our prey, whether it be dinosaur or other survivors...

ARK gets an 8/10 from me, It would be 10/10 but the optimization holds back the score due to it causing the gameplay to have issues as well. Once improved, I will edit this and give it the 10/10 it deserves because the developers are the best I have ever seen. OTHER DEVELOPERS TAKE NOTE OF THESE GUYS, THEY ARE DOING IT RIGHT.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Review time, first off this game is amazing, absolutely beautiful and fun to play, but there are soooo many balance issues.  I have tried to play this game everyway there is to play it.  The only way to be successful on this game is to start playing after a fresh wipe, have no life, dont mind being a slave to the e key and have a Large group of friends just as dedicated to have no life as you.  Or Join a mega tribe that is already extablished on a server and play with a bunch of D bag guy that you dont know who would destroy you if you didnt join them.  There is absolutely no way to be successful on this game even with a group of 3 very dedicated players working day and night on improving your base and making weapons and farming oil and yadayadayada.... a Big well established tribe of guys you only want to steal your fun and hard work not even your loot will come and wreck you and all your bases in under an hour.  I have tried going nomad and caveman style fighting the mega tribe with bows and arrows and even gun i can manage to craft with having no real base to speak of.  It goes ok for a little bit and have fun til they catch you and litterally imprison you for DAYS.... they had 4 guys in their tribe dedicated to keeping me sedated and fed and watered and imprisoned for literally a week.  So these major balance issues make the game extremely unfun in the long run, I find myself really unmotivated to try and rebuild after the 8th time being wiped out.  It takes way too much effort to build anything worth building, it takes too little effort for your enemies to destroy it all and I dont want to be forced to play with the same type of guys who wipe me out by joining them just to enjoy the end game.

I love this game but i gotta give it a bad review til they fix the serious balance issues and make the game playable and enjoyable for smaller groups or the nomad player.  Progress is impossible without a megatribe of at least 10 guys who are organized and dedicated at least 10 hours a day to this game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Do I really have to write a review for this game? Awww, come on, can't I just let the review section rot in insensability? For just a while? Okay, fine.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
I know this review is a little bit late, but I wanted to wait till after all of the hype, arguements, and poor optimization. So, I waited two weeks (and it was a great wait, considering the reward). Off to the review!

Gameplay: I just can't stop playing this game- it's too damn fun. To put it short, there's an extreme variety of gameplay to suit all the needs of your tiny attention spans. Whether you want to build an army of ♥♥♥♥♥♥aurus-rexes to conquer the  ARK and claim it as your own, build a magnifecent castle for all to see, or just annoy the hell out of other 'specimens', it's all up to you. In that way, it's like minecraft. But it's also like the traditional survival game, forcing you to use your wits and your reflexes to survive on your own(or with your friends/enemies) against the elements(and dinosaurs). And last of all, it's like an RPG. The progression is what truely sets it apart from other survival games. It's really the first game I've ever felt like I was actually learning something. Not even The Elder Scrolls could do that for me. It's the variety of choices, the way it forces you to use your wits, and its progression that truly makes it one of a kind. 10/10

Graphics: Is there really anything I have to say for this? It looks stunning, and I've never had a moment when I was pulled away from the game just because it felt 'plasticy'. 10/10

Optimization: Okay, this is the one thing that ARK did poorly on... While it runs great on my machine, I'm sure people with lower end PCs will have to severely sacrifice graphics to play the game. And I'm talking dinosaurs that look like they came from 1920's. I'd say anything below a medium quality gaming PC just won't cut it, at least for now. Note that they are improving the optimization over time, so I would recomend looking at other reviews to be sure that you can't run the game. 5/10

Originality: One of the most refreshing games in the survival genre is what this is. Instead of saying This is a multiplayer game
date: so let's forget about survival" they went all out and gave it a ton of survival features. At first I thought it was going to be rust with ♥♥♥♥♥♥auruses
recommended: but it wasn't. The emphasis on survival

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Seniority reigns supreme.

The game punishes new players:
If you're looking to join a PvE server, GOOD LUCK getting a base setup because of foundation spamming.
people will occupy miles of land at a time by placing foundations that don't let you build anywhere around it.
If you decide to buy this game, the first thing you will see is wooden pillars everywhere.
Why do people need 10 miles of land at a time? They don't. People actually sell off parts of land.

I think the concept of Squatter's rights is a little dated.


If you want to try on a PvP server, you get dominated by whoever has the largest presence and therefore the most dinosaurs under their control.
Oh and let's not forget the AFK raiding; when offline an enemy will just walk to your base and dismantle it with no problem.


The Game hates your hardware:
I use an R9 290, with an i5-4670k. The ONLY way to get 60 fps is by making the game look like the original Turok.

The official servers love to lag:
Rubberbanding is incredibly common and in semi-frequent intervals.
The game will lag out across the board for something like 30 seconds at a time every few minutes.

Edit:
Now as for the privately owned unofficial servers"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

In its current state, my first hour was met with poor FPS on the lowest of settings, Dinosaurs that glitched around when trying to fight them and then if I could manage to kill them, the corpses had a habit of just soaring off into the sky.

You start out naked, without any clue of what to do, I punched a dodo and lost health with every hit, I punched it for meat, losing health on every hit, I punched a tree for wood to make an axe, lost health doing so. Using your bare hands causes you to lose life while harvesting or fighting, which is insanely stupid. I could understand after a few hits if you lost a little life, for your hands being all bloody, but still.

At one point while chasing a floating corpse, I fell into the rock texture and got stuck for a minute. After some jumping and trying to escape being stuck inside the rock texture, I freed myself only to find my vigorous excercise left me starving and rapidly losing health because of it.

The food bar depleats way, way too quickly. I get its supposed to be survival and that running and such makes you hungrier than normal, but not even one day/night cycle left me out of food multiple times.

TL;DR:
Looks great on epic settings, optimization lacking.
Buggy, very buggy.

TL;DR Don't buy now, it's not likely to improve soon.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is the shining example of what Early Access is all about.

Do you like survival games? This is for you.
Do you like building/crafting? This is for you.
Do you like dinosaurs? This is for you until you're eaten by raptors.

There are constant, large updates to this game adding content such as new dinosaurs, items and structures, performance improvements and bug fixes. If you find yourself thinking I wish they add X or fix Y." it's most likely going to be patched in a few days.

If you've played Gmod Stranded or Rust
date: this is very similar to those if they were on steroids and added dinosaurs.\n\nWhen I first started playing this

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I've waited quite a while to review this game. I feel like now's the time to review it, though.

Recently, some changes were made to the stats of our tamed dinos. For example, damage and health was nerfed. Quite much.

Now dinos are just as weak, or even weaker, than their wild counterparts. Dinos that I have spent many hours taming and then weeks leveling.. They're all weaker than their three minute old wild counterparts. Something that spawned in a minute ago can destroy what I've spent hours and days achieving. Then what's the point in taming, if I'm going to loose whatever I've tamed? I see none.

Another point that bugs me is the way they handled our money. I paid for the PC version, and the devs went and made an XBONE version instead of focusing on making the PC version run decent. The XBONE version runs two times better on two times worse hardware. The game still has horrible optimization on PC. Horrible. A 970 or 980 should be able to play on at least high without having to play in 10 fps. There's games out there that both look and run ten times better.

A third complaint is the occurance of hackers. They're quite literally everywhere. They ruin many official servers, making them impossible to play on. And the devs don't care at all, either. You can send as many emails to them as you want, it will make no difference.

I would recommend this game if it weren't for the above problems. But as it stands now, I would recommend no-one to play this game until it's sorted out.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

After spending 400+ hours on this game why is it negative?
I started playing from July and on until November where the new updates started come and break down the once, amazing game of Ark into a completely unbalanced and one-sided game. Starting from the implementation of the Giganotosaurus update the game has been going completely downhill. The developers used to listen to the forums and community but have been shutting down everyone who has even the slightest critisizm.  I am truly pained to write this review because Wildcard tried so hard to make this game to where it was. Though I would like to thank Ark for giving me 460 hours of complete fun and amazing gameplay, I think it is time to move on to another game that has a better community and more understanding developers.  Though for new players that have thirty bucks and can waste a few hours, try playing singleplayer and find unofficial servers that are balanced with clean admins.  After that don't get yourself tied up into this same mess and find a new game before this gets to you.

After 100 hours I suggest you move on

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI'd like to start and say I've ran a server for ARK since launch.  All the people on my server enjoyed and played pretty regularly.  My regulars have an average of anywhere between 500 and 1200 hours in game.  The game was fun up and until this last patch.  Our server is pretty much a standard server other than the day/night cycle.  This means that the tame times on the dinos was what the dev's left it at.  So you are looking at a 3 hour tame for a T-Rex, which is a long time.  Now after the patch the tame time vs. what you get after taming is no where even close to being balanced.  I can't recommend this game to anyone anymore because it doesn't seem like a good idea in it's current state.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI bought the came when it first came out for early access. Then the game was unplayable, but every day the devs worked really hard to fix the problems. They continue  to update and enhance on a regular basis even now, with quality content and improvements. The game itself is tough, it doesn't hold your hand and it's a lot of trial by error and dying when you begin. As you level you start to tame more dinos, improve your buildings improve your weapons. Everything makes sense as you work towards the next tier of items. I totally love the design of the dinosaurs, keeping it very authentic to what our fossil records show. Nothing beats starting and having your screen shake as a giant brontosaurus walks on by. If you  wanna Play a fun and tough survival game with DINOSAURS, and you don't mind early access this is the game for you! Especially if it keeps improving the way it is now.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Punched a dodo bird,
his flock came after me.
Led them to Mr. T-Rex,
Mr.T-Rex had a lovely meal

20/10

====
EDIT
====
In all seriousness, ark is a wonderful game, even optimization is getting better.
I still cannot figure out why everyone complains that their cheap computers <$800 cannot run the game. After all, it is a next gen game. The game is still in early access, and so, would as expected, have lots o' bugs, exploits, and low optimization.

The developers are incredibly friendly, update the game extremely regularly and are, in general, are up there with some of the worlds best devs. If you are one of those cheapo's who return the game just because you have a sh*t computer and thought that the minimal specs were what you need to run max graphics, Your a big piece of dino poop, and your base deserves to be raided by the chinese,

Do yourself a favor, and get a somewhat decent computer before you buy the game.


Sincerly,
Aqua Dark

=======
Update 2
=======
Recently switched servers from official 305 to an unnofficial server, and I greatly recommend you do the same if you are tired of not being able to build a proper base without being killed.

Official servers are aimed towards those who want to experience the most the game has to offer at its hardest as well as those who do not play casual (casual = <3-5 hr/day

reviewText:
Early Access Review

don't buy this game, the early game stage of this game is fun, and it may look prety and everything, but this game is extremely poorly balanced, on official servers, you WILL just be bullied off(because large tribes can literally keep you locked up permanently), and finding a good unofficial server is very hard.
this game is both an unbalanced grindfest, and a literal waiting game. of the 600+ hours i played, about 60% was literally WAITING for dino's to be tamed, and all sorts of other things that you literally have to wait for, because if you leave for more than 5 minutes, whatever you were doing, WILL fail.
about 20% of the game was grinding materials to build the simplest of things, that weren't even worth the time really.
15% of it was grinding in the way of; going around the island, killing everything in sight for a small amount of exp for my dino's.
and for the final 5% i was actually enjoying myself.
oh, did i already mention that the game devs are incapable of basic maths, are lazy when it comes to actually fixing issues, they love adding overpowered things that only the biggest and strongest tribes on servers have acces to (making them literally unbeatable, this was an issue when i started playing, and its only become worse and worse over time) they never actually test things they add for balance, only to see if it works or not (and even that they barely do) and have proven again and again to be sadistic ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s by adding things to the game (like holliday events) that aren't even possible without cheats, and even THEN its hard.

this game has been a massive waste of my time AND money, i regret buying it, and now permanently having it in my steam game list.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I have mixed feelings on this game.

It is a great game if you play on your own, or with people you know, on a private server.  It's a blast.

Public servers, on the other hand, are the worst.  On PvP servers you get trolls having a laugh harrassing the lower levels, so you can't play on there without an extraordinary amount of patience.  PvE servers are not much better, with every starting area blanketed by player-made structures so there's nowhere for someone new to an established server to actually start.

I like this game.  It's enjoyable when I play by myself, or on a friend's private server.  That's the only way I can enjoy the game.  It is not fun being trolled constantly while trying to dodge dinosaurs that can easily kill you, while trying to avoid starvation and get your first basic essentials.  Avoid the public servers like the plague.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

If you look at this game's progression over time, and the direction the devs are taking, this game is in the process of stagnating pretty bad and major issues are not being addressed.

There's a pretty bad problem that's existed for a while now where griefers can obtain admin rights and ♥♥♥♥ up entire arks.

There are still major issues with just doing simple building, you can be utterly at the mercy of terrain with a seriously unforgiving collision detection system and at times completely bizzare building behavior in the interface.  Some components like foundations, walls, etc will simply not want to build, or will build but auto-disappear, costing you significant amount of mats.

A recent mega-nerf to tamed dinosaur HP and output has basically made taming way too risky, as the taming speed is still default (HIDEOUSLY slow for any dino worth its weight), meaning it's now 2-3x more easy to lose your pets.

The last half dozen updates have not really added any actual content except for some new dino species, and yet each update measures 1.5 - 3 gig each time.

♥♥♥♥ riding kangaroos, please add progression or content to the game.   How about a procedual map?   It only takes about 20 minutes to get from one end of the map to the other.

This level of development was great a year and a half ago, by now the game should have been much further along, instead the devs took a huge chunk of they money given to them by PC sales and decided to push out an Xbox port rather than actually complete the game.   WHY in the WORLD would you build the game for another platform while it's still in alpha?  That just means the devs now have to do twice the updates with the same team size and resources, meaning everyone loses in the long run.

This is very unfortunate, and another prime example of devs torpedoing their own game.
voteText: 18 of 25 people (72%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I'm deeply disappointed in this game, and I'm not sure where to start.

Let's go for graphics first. Yes, the game looks nice... for a slideshow. The highest settings make the game so unbearably laggy, you can't play without feeling sick. Every game I own I can play on top quality, but this I had to slam down to lowest. So all those nice screenshots were pointless, because the game is a pixelated nightmare, rendering rocks every few steps.

Then there's server stability. There's a lot of lag going on, so you bounce around occasionally or find that the last minute of you mining never happened and you're actually 20ft away staring at the ground. With a giant crocodile eating you. A game built to be experienced with multiple people, and  we're stuck with servers that run on hamster power.

But for the gameplay itself, I just can't figure it out. Sure, there's a steep learning curve, and you have to look up everything online to figure out what's going on. But there are features that are just frustrating. You can starve to death trying to work out how to play the game, or end up freezing or bleeding out just trying to get your first pick and axe. You get mashed by pretty much every creature around you before you can do anything good.

I can't comment on taming because I couldn't even make it that far. I tried to tame this small pig thing and it just murdered me after the first hit. No idea what I was doing, just waving a club around and hoping to put berries in it. Tried again, but a massive bird decided to kill me. I couldn't outrun it, either.

All in all, a game that has potential but seems to be restricted by its own features.

Edit: Also, the game frequently crashes the graphics driver. I had a R9 270x, which should be more than enough to play on lowest settings. Even so, the GPU crashes and then the game closes. This has apparently been an issue for months now, according to threads on the forums.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Intense graphics - Check.
Open world - Check.
Extensive crafting - Check.
Player progress - Check.
Fun - ....pending refund.

I find the game too persistent.  Being killed/looted while offline is a bit much.  I also find that requiring 2-4 hours to tame a dino in a world where everything is perishable to be...boring  (don't worry, they are killed while you are offline due to starvation or murder).

This is NOT a game for those with any kind of commitments, as simply logging off is essentially suicide.  Of course, logging on is suicide too, I suppose.  I guess I just don't find enjoyment in the community.  I also don't find enjoyment in spending hours running back and forth to a dino with a progress bar telling me that taming is 25% done after over an hour of scavenging.

TL:DR - Go watch paint dry while someone is poking you in the eye with a broom instead.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I'll put my 1 penny to the game; like in high school, I gave 1 penny to a foreign exchange student and told her to buy her self something nice and she cracked up laughing. Now I'm 19, so let's get into the review.

PROS:
+You can make farms, irrigations and a huge base.
+Leveling system.
+Can play with a lot of friends.
+Tame dinosaurs.
+Preset map but always prochedurally generated resources for each new server or reset.
+Clever character transfer system, also can transfer dinosaurs.
+There is a singleplayer mode.
+Persistent world (if you logout, your character turns into a ragdoll where you logged out, can be looted, killed, base destroyed, etc).
+PVP modes and PVE modes.
+You can make ugly, looking, horrible abomination looking characters, my character is Thoraghk the Womanizer" and I started a clan called the Womanizer Clan and I had like 10 people in it and 1 was a female (lol).
+Animals can collect resources
date:
fight for you.

CONS:
-Leveling to 60 can take HOURS; it took me literally 85 real life hours to get to level 43.
-This game consumes your life

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Best 915 hours of my life I've ever spent. I was lucky enough to find a great server my first pick, and its been the only server I've played on for all those hours. Great community. Terrific game, basically everythingg you've ever wanted in a video game. There's so much I want to say about the game, I just can't put it into words. One thing though, this game is very time consuming, taming dinosaurs may take hours depending on the species and level of it. Many times you may get raided or simply walking around, and lose the dino you just spent hours taming. Or even spend hours building a perfect castle that you've always dreamed of making, if there's one thing I've learned, it's that you shouldn't take pride in having/owning those dino's or structures. You should take pride in seeing them being built or tamed, and enjoy every second of gathering the resources to do so that way if they get lost, you're not too bummed out about it, because I'm telling you, you will lose certain items, dinos, or structures and it's going to suck. Just don't get down about it, don't be scared to get back up a keep going.

Wildcard is really offering something different with this game, and they do their best to give new content and provide the best experience. I've definitely caught myself and friends saying, damn this lag sucks" or "why is this thing glitching" or just generally something weird happening
date: you have to remember IT'S AN EARLY ACCESS GAME
hoursPlayed: but it's damn near it."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

A solid and fun game. Comepletely playable although you may have to tweak the settings a bit in it's current state to play the game without frame issues. Being early access means that the game isn't properly optimized yet. There are some small glitches climbing certain terrain(Steep hills) but other than that the only real bug is the trees occasionally flapping around uncontrollably.

The gameplay is interesting and in depth. Crafting system works and the leveling system is rewarding. When you level you actually do get excited to learn new engrams and get new crafted parts and weapons. Some of the dinosaurs are dumb and easy to kill and rightfully so, other dinosaurs will send you flying and running for your life. Playing the game alone may be difficult but in a group of 2 or 3 there is a lot of excitement and adventure to be found.

Overall if you are willing to play a game that isn't optimized YET with some minor bugs this is one of the best values you can get on an early access game. There were already new builds launched yesterday during the big stream event and the game is constantly improving. Once optimized I can see this game being a top tier game especially once it gets mod support.

If you support early access games at all this game is a no brainer, If you don't support early access games you should still think about this one.

Addition: Day 2 ran much smoother than day 1. The game is frequently updated and getting better by the day.
voteText: 14 of 18 people (78%) found this review helpful

If you support early access games at all this game is a no brainer, If you don't support early access games you should still think about this one.

Addition: Day 2 ran much smoother than day 1. The game is frequently updated and getting better by the day.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The game is obviously not 100% polished but that is what you should expect when buying into an alpha game. There will be bugs, optimization issues and server problems. What you do get is a glimpse of an amazing engine (one of the first games with Unreal 4) with the survivor element that includes many differernt types of dinosaurs.

My experience with the game was only on a private server because coming from the software development world and playing day 1 release of popular MMO's, you sure as hell can't count on playing the game on an official server.

Server hosting was fairly simple after the devs communicated instructions with a few hiccups. For some reason there is region locking on private servers which makes it a little difficult for friends to join unless they use http://arkservers.net/server.

As for the game, I was fairly impressed with the amount of content and quality for a day 1 alpha release. We did not run into many game breaking bugs other than graphic laggyness with some options. As long as the developers continue to update and support the game, I can see this becoming a terrific game in the future.

Pros
Huge world
Wide variety of dinosaurs, some extremely massive
Animal AI (running up the beach to see a gigantic alligator take down some the raptors chasing us was pretty epic)
Leveling system with stats
Exploration elements with various landmarks and missions
Graphics, even though not fully optimized
In-game proxmity voice works great along with mouth movement
Map system allows you to chart out your exploration while also not showing you where you are to make you learn the landscape to create immersion
Cons
Low framerate which is expected
Spear durability randomness
Character models - too lenient in creation makes it unrealistic and heights dont always fit the buildings
No manipulation of land ie digging into the ground
Harvesting system can be improved
In-game font and UI
Server region locking
Crates use inventory by weight instead of slots/nuimber of items which doesn't make much sense

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The game is awesome. It really is. Excellent modding support, beautiful graphics, loads of fun to be had.
I played both on official and unofficial PvE servers, played co-op PvE with other tribes collaborating together to improve our Ark life, et caetera.
The ONE gripe I have with the game is the lack of experience of the developer (Studio Wildcard) from a customer interaction standpoint. Their patch notes are spartan. Their ETAs are hit-and-miss numerous times. Their overall customer interaction is slim. It looks like they focused purely on development and forgot about this customer interaction vital component. The result is a series of patches and events which antagonize and polarize the player base - showing a certain disconnect between players and developers.
While a month ago I would have recommended this game wholeheartedly, the introduction of the Giganotosaurus, the Winter Wonderland event, the Industrial Cooker debacle, the Raptor Santa event and the Ball Drop event, topped of by patch 231.0 (which shortly put is an 80% nerf to tamed dinos health and melee damage) have changed my mind.

I understand this is an early access game but the changes introduced and not-so-well-thought-out in-game events force me to make the following recommendation:
* Add this game to Follow
* Add this game to your Wishlist
* Buy it 6 months from now or if there's a huge discount (50% or more)

Or if you decide to buy now, for the love of God, please don't invest time in playing the game on an official server! Not because they're bad (the server I play on is awesome from a player population perspective), but because unexpected large changes to the game core (such as patch 231) can only be mitigated on unofficial servers through setting editing. If you play on an official server, you're in the developer's pocket and trust me on this: from what I've seen during last month, you don't want to be there.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Game Pros
• Open World
• Weapons ranging from spears, to rocket launchers, and turrets
• Weather System
• Multiplayer
• Crafting system
• Consistent updates
• Day/Night Cycle
• Ton of skills to master
• Base building
• Grouping/Spawning System
• PvP/PvE
• You can tame/ride dinosaurs
• Steam workshop
• Selfie/Orbit Cam so you can look at yourself
• You can host Servers and have access to console commads
• 3rd person (Can be accessed on servers that have it enabled)

Game Cons
• Currently has spotty FPS on majority of systems (Needs optomization work)
• Dinosaurs hover on certain terrain (Very minor)
• Dinosaurs need pathfinding work
• Chance of spawning on a hostile dinosaur, killing you upon spawn

Relateable Games
• Rust
• The Forest

Conclusion
ARK is an amazing game, But rememeber that the game is still in ALPHA STAGES. It still has a ways to go before it finished, but it is headed in the right direction. It gets your heart pumping when you have a lot to lose, and you got a giant dinosaur chasing you down through a forest.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

So, before I get started, let me explain the bad things (that are kind of expected with Early Access).

The servers lag every now and then. It's not exactly common, but it happens.
Wonky hit boxes.
Stupid AI (Trikes are some of the easiest things to fight).
Slow tames dinos.
Enemy lag - it's really hard to fight enemies because they'll lag behind you, beside you, 10 feet away from you, etc).
The occasional crash (only once).

Now that that's out of the way, I can go on about the good.
I can pretty much sum up everything I like about this game with a story:

I have a little house on a hill. It's nothing special, but it's home. After taming guard-dog-like fat people killers, a Ducky, and an Earthwalker, I decided it was high time I explored the cast island.
I knew where I was based on pretty easy land marks (maps don't have magicl GPS system that lets you know where you are. You have to figure it out yourself), and I kinda knew which direction I'd go.
I didn't know this at the time of setting out on my adventure, but the coastline breaks off into a river that makes a huge circle around my home.
And lucky for me (foreshadowing alert), I recently got the the level at which I could craft a bow and arrows.

I set out to my adventure. I've gone out pretty far before, and my dinos are usually able to fend for themselves (by that I mean stay out of sight from predators, and unfriendly neighbores. Seriously, the place I set up shop in is pretty safe). I didn't look back, and didn't take any of my dinos with me (because they're too slow)...
A few miles into my journy, I discover the river I mentioned earlier, and decided to follow it - crafting arrows along the way. I got another level up, and was able to put points into a hide shirt, which would also come in handy, granted not as much as the bow.
I stupidly head inland, because I see supply crates out in the far, far distance. I've gotten some pretty neat stuff in them before, and I wanted to go exploring, so I thought why not!"
How foolish. If I'd have known about the tribulations I'd face on the path

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I can't honestly recommend ARK to anyone.  Not anymore.

In the short 1-2 months I have played ARK I have put more time in total than Terraria over the many years that Terraria has been out.  I felt that, like Terraria, playing a game earlier on in its lifespan was better since you could experience the new while having dealt with the old.  It was a sort of way of forcing you to experience the content at a slower pace.  But patch 231 came out and changed everything.

Maybe it is better off for the changes and people who start now will have as much fun as I did but it isn't the same game I played a week ago.  It isn't the same game I enjoyed.  Not anymore.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Unless you can play this game on private servers where the admins actually punish people who cross the line, then don't bother with this. Don't get me wrong: this game is great fun at times. But it is also grindy as hell and requires an immense time committment. And yet all of that time and effort can be wiped away by some no-lifer who is online 24/7 who gets off on making other people miserable. The devs and admins, put simply, don't care that one tribe can literally make an entire server unplayable and destroy thousands of hours of player progress.

And while it is true that one should expect PvP in a PvP game, when it crosses the line into bullying, then it drains all the fun out of it. Even if you get someone banned by the devs when they cross the line, they just make a new account and keep going. Under circumstances like that, i'll make more productive use of my time banging my head against the wall.

Don't play on official servers. Play on private servers with active admins who don't let people ♥♥♥♥ people, and then keep ♥♥♥♥ing them again and again in order to make others miserable. If you can find a good one, then you can probably have an awesome playing experience. But, because my review concerns the official servers the devs run, this game gets a negative review because that aspect of the game isn't worth it at all.

The game is great. The community of the official servers is disgusting.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nAt present, I cannot recommend the game.  I won't spend a ton of time dishing out insults.  The game is beautiful, the concept is excellent, and has been extremely fun.  The problem comes in the last few patches.  In 231.0 they put out a massive dino nerf, that unfortunately, made about half the island dinos obselete.  The tamed dinos were indeed too powerful, however,  I feel that the nerf was not well thought out and done in haste.  Currently, if you run into an alpha or a giganotosaurus, you're going to die.  If you have any dinos defending you, they're going to die, then you are.  In general, good luck surviving if you're a new player.  My suggestion at present, would be to wait on the game for a few months, maybe 3 - 4, then check back to see if the balance issues have been better worked/reworked.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

In the games current state I would suggest that you hold off on your purchase of said product. The game is fun when playable. However there are alot of server issues with the game in its current state where the lag spikes can get you killed in more ways then one, for example i was swimming the server hit a huge lag spike my character then was dead by the time the lag subsided from drowning , another time i was out harvesting items to build my house when yet another lag spike reared up and i was attacking my a group of raptors and by time the spike went away yet again i was dead.

Other game breaking issues that still havent been fix are the fact the dinos can kill you through walls inside your house when your not there then when you log in your house is not destroyed but youve been killed, in my case this has happened 3 different times on one very fustrating occasion i logged in to being killed and having all of my items missing from my house even though my house was still intact so i was apparently killed through walls and the dinos destroyed all the items in my house not anyone else as this was a PVE server and not a PVP server. And today i logged into having been killed again by dinos but to top it off my home was filled with rocks to the point I couldnt enter or exit or get to my chests to create a item with which to break them with.

Im tired of seeing these developers adding in new content while failing to prioritize the game killing bugs like the ones mentioned above. these devs are not addressing any of the major issues instead they keep pouring in more and more content ( which is good for a finished product) , but in this case they are not holding themselves up to a level of detail that I myself would claim to be professional, the content adding should be halted until they have the major issues fixed.

If you dont care about losing hours of work or dying in your home from dinos that seem to be like casper the ghost and your not easily fustrated at things like that then this game maybe fun for you, if your like me who has PTSD and gets upset because your dying from random things like server lag and dinos that go through walls then i suggest you save you money and spend it else where on a finished product that has good reviews.

this game has good reviews but to many are fan boys who adobt games early and can find no flaws or just dont care that there money is spent on good quality products so as of now i cannot recommend this game knowning that is has major issues that alot of people are not addressing.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Below you'll find a written and video impression of the game
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=z4RI1bGPbtc
Ark is an open world survival sandbox with dinosaurs in Early Access. Though there have been others with a similar concept in the past, Ark is by far the most ambitous of the bunch.

In Ark you have your usual tasks from the survival sandbox genre. You run around gathering simple materials such as rocks, and wood, and from that you'll make your first simple tool. From there you can start crafting some simple structures. It's pretty usual stuff for the genre, but Ark has a few tricks up it's sleeves to set itself apart. There's a large focus on training dinosaurs in this game. Once trained there are a nice few things you can do with them. You can sadle them up and ride them for more efficient transportation, have them follow you like a watch dog, and even mate them with others. You can raise an army of dinos who will follow you into combat while you mount your favorite one. It's even possible to mount teradactols, allowing the player to experiance flight!

Ark also features an interesting progression system as well. Each level you gain you'll be able to level up one of your main stats and be rewarded points that go towards unlocking more advnaced recipes. Crafting is on a progressive scale, much like your level. As you gain higher levels, more advnaced recipes will become available. It's a nice system, as it gives the player a sense of progress and something clear to strive for.

The graphics are quality as well. The game features extremly high fedelity enviroments, with great looking textures and models, highlighted by some amazing lighting and effects. The sound design is also quite nice with believable roars from the dinos around you.

Though Ark has a ton to offer even in it's early access form, the game isn't with out problems. At the moment the main concern is performance. Due to the game's extremely high fidelity, the game doesn't run very well on low-mid tier machines. I had to fiddle around with the exe file and a bunch of Nvidia setting to get even 20 FPS out of the game. It has been making incremental improvements, but the majority of the problem still persist as of this impression. Another critique I have is Ark could use a tutorial. I didn't have too much of an issue jumping into the game, but only because I've played my share of survival games. For those who are new to the genre, Ark does nothing for those players. There's no tutorial, no guide, not even popup help tips. It just throws the player into the middle of a jungle and hope for the best. Hopefully a proper tutorial will be added before the release of the game out of early access.

Overall Ark is an extremely enjoyable survival game that puts the dinos in the fore front of it's features. The game is ambitious and the content feels very satasfying. It just needs to run smoother, a LOT smoother.

Pros:
- Dinosaurs are varied and intrical to the game's design
- A pile of content right from day one!
- Enjoyable progression system

Cons:
- Performance needs a major overhaul
- No tutorial for new players

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I feel like I wasted time and money on this product. I want to like this game it has dinosaurs, but as it is right now it is too frustrating.
And all I got to account for the experience are griefed buildings and a possible brain aneurism.

This game play is grindy, especially if you are solo. You will die a lot, sometimes immediately upon spawning into the world. If you can, I recommend a friend, things will go faster and you will be less likely to be dicked over.

Be careful choosing your server. Look out for mods that may make your gameplay glitchy. I played one server and lost too much progress.

The game is buggy as well, I once dragged a fish out of the water while starving and it floated above my head just out of reach, as if ARK gods were taunting me.

I don’t recommend this game for people who are nice and want to play fair, it will just spit it back into your face.

If I do pick up this game to play again, it will be for offline mode only, just to limit the BS as much as possible.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

So I think it's quite important that I explain this game to people interested in buying this game just what lies beneath the serface of this trailer and reviews of other people. A diamond in the rough, yes she is a bit unoptimised at the moment, but people with crap computers I know can run it just fine, if you can run a game like star citizen chances are you can run this game in its current state without any problems, people who complain about perfomace issues are justified but half of them dont have computers made for this level of gaming or they just arent working properly. (I saw a post about a guy complaining of bad fps with ddr2 ram in his computer...)
As for the game itself, the constant updates and development makes space engineers weekly updates look like the devs are being lazy. The future plans open this game up for much then just a game, a total experiance worth being played for a long, long time to come.
Players who complain about being raided are justified but there is also more to that side of the story, proper base location can be vital to staying alive offline (dont make a thatch house in t-rex terrortory and expect to survive.)
PVP is a choice not a required thing, server choice is key and if you dont like it well then guess what... ARK lets you pack up your dinos and charicter and leave, a feature that I wish was in every game.
This game has so much content, detail, dev support, updates, replayibility, imersion, excitment and fun in it that the game keeps you coming back for more again and again. You get borred of it, come back a week or two latter and now there is 10 updates of content waiting for you. Not to mention how often they optimise the game.
Its no game for the faint of heart, but if your brave, take the leap go for it, this game will not disipoint if its played the right way. Long live ARK the most revolutionary survival game since minecraft

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is an early access game, but it is not alpha or even beta. This has been said by others, but what game in beta has seasonal events and tourneys where money is a reward?

Overall, it is a great game with fun concepts but like most online games that try to have PVP and PVE in the same build, it does not work perfectly. It is a survival game where you can tame dinosaurs to help you survive and thrive. A great draw since who doesn't want to tame and ride a dinosaur!?

Many of the dinos have specialties to help gather resources and protect yourself and your other dinos. It helps reduce the grind required to build something large or gather resources in hard to reach places and environments. I loved the natural progression of that idea, where you could jump from collecting by hand to using a dino and it kept the game fresh for me.

Now, I only play PVE on a private server and will never play PVP on this game where grifers will live to destroy what you have built since nothing is protected when you log off. Anything and everything you own is open for theft and destruction while you are offline, so I hear you need a large tribe that is very active or get used to restarting from scratch quite often. Doesn't sound fun to me.

While I do like the game, I am hesitant to recommend it as early access with the recent changes. I agree that the tamed dinos were over powered and could have used a tweak, but to make them not much better than an equivalent wild one when you have to invest much in time and materials to tame them? That I cannot agree as a good course of action. They are sucking the fun out of the game, which happens all to often while trying to balance PVP and PVE together. It doesn't work, you can't make everyone happy, so you end up making everyone miserable. To tame and breed dinos is a HUGE investment of time, so when there is minmal reward who will bother?

I'm sure the developers are trying to make the best game they can, but I dislike any game that is less fun to play and feels more like a job. That is the direction ARK is headed in my opinion.
voteText: 19 of 29 people (66%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Hello!
I was reading some of the reviews and I found myself agreeing with many of the negative reviews.



1.
The amount of time this game requires does not allow people who cannot pour several hours STRAIGHT into taming or gathering resources.  (You know people that have school and jobs and stuff)

2.
I had read in several reviews that the multiplayer is really bad.  Personally I did not have much experience with interacting with other people when I played this game.  However I did notice the strategic placement of pillars, clearly meant to prevent others from building there.  Other reviews also said that the Alpha Tribes pretty much control anything and make it impossible to play without joining them.

3.
I felt that most of my time playing this game was spent waiting for loading screens because it crashed what felt like every fifteen or so min. (Keep in mind I last played this in January 2016, so I do not know what changes might have been made.)

4.
One reason I stopped playing this game was that, on top of frequent crashes, I found that the fps I recieved was not ideal for continuing on with the amount of effort required to play this game.  I recently looked at the requirements and it shows a processor that is under mine and a graphics card that is signifagantly lower, (GPU w/ 1GB ram VS GTX 960 - correct me if I'm wrong.)  This seems frustrating due the fps that I recieved.  (I also have a Pentium Anniversary Processor which is overclocked to 4.0 Ghz.)

5.
The game just drops you into areas with REDICULOUSLY hard dinosaurs.  The way the devs did their game is very interesting and kind of cool, but this also leaves a HUGE learning curve for new players.  (especially with the bigger tribes hogging all the land or killing a new player while they are away.)  I feel that the game should give more breathing room for new player to develop instead of sticking carnivores literally on the beach.  (I can't even imagine what it is like further inland. - and no, i have not gotten that far)



On the subject of tribes, I was actually lucky to have found a really nice guy who actually began an all noob tribe. (The server I was on actually seemed very nice)  We had a blast and genuinely helped each other out.  However, reading other reviews, it sounds like this may be a difficult thing now.  I don't like to hear that other players are being treated so poorly and I think it takes away from a game signifigantly when the players are not friendly to each other.  Considering everything, I find myself not recommending this game.

P.S.  -  Please, go ahead and tell me if there are any new updates that improve performance as I have not played in a while.

PROS -

Great Graphics
Great Machanics
Interesting World
Cool Wildlife

CONS -

Abuse of Tribe System
Low FPS (as of January)
Crashes
Severe Difficulty (T-Rex , Spinasourus Rampage upon spawn)
REDICULOUSLY long taming time



I could probably say more, but I'm gonna leave it to that.
I am not a regular reviewer so sorry is my formatting is a little wierd.  Thank You!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Short and Sweet. The performance is better than it originally was but still needs work and requires significant tweaking. There is a LOT of content and things to do which makes it interesting. A lot of my friends love this game and with over 1800 hours on RUST I was looking for an alternative and tried this again. Initial 25 hours to level 15 is a key milestone due to the access to certain crafting items (wood structure, bow and arrow, growing crops). I had been raided every day due to thatch doors and finally got everything wood today.

Story: Was on my last gathering of berries and stone while collecting poop for fertalizer for crops and something very unexpected happened. I had just minutes before read about the largest dino on the island and it was in front of my face. Not sure if it was going after me, I stopped and hoped it wouldn't see me"... It went straight for me and it insta-killed me! Ok
hoursPlayed: crazy...Wouldn't expect less. I was hopeful I'd be able to get my stuff back so after I respawned and mentioned it in chat
voteText: this group called Verra (OfficialServer1) said it was them. I now assume I won't get my stuff back so I return to my base only to see that they have immediately started tearing it down...\n\nBase was completely wiped off the map in 60 seconds with one person using a Gigantosaurus. No ♥♥♥♥s given. Quite possibly the most OP thing I've seen in any game ever. I understand it's the biggest dino... I'm not sure what the devs could/would change to alter the outcome of a situation like this. I was told to start a new character on another server by this Verra group - I imagine it would be the same thing with a different group on another server. I suppose this is worse case scenario but I've been on the fence about this game for a long time

this just puts me back over the fence for now.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Incredibly fun for the short time I've played.  The optimization needs a lot of work as a lot of people have said, but I'm running a GTX 650 Ti with low/medium mixed settings and hitting 15 FPS at worst, 25 at best.  You're going to hear some people claiming it's unplayable and that's fine, but it really all depends on what your idea of unplayable is.  If you NEED epic graphics at 60 FPS and 1080p, wait for a bit.  If you can handle medium graphics at 30 FPS, come and get it.

There's a few lag issues right now with community servers, but that's being worked on.  Game received 5 updates since release, and there's been a noticeable improvement in performance and connectivity.  Cut the dev team some slack: They're open and honest, they're filling us in as they work, and they're trying to get this shindig going.

Anyways, here's the mandatory Pro/Con list

+Simple, but clear tutorial
+DInosaurs really make you fear the jungle.
+Hell, Dinosaurs make you fear leaving the light of the camp fire.
+Crafting is fun, resources are easy to collect.
+You can drink salt-water?
+Can poop on command
+I pooped on a scorpion
+Stung my ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥
+The lighting is really nice MOST of the time.  The dark is African Sahara black, the transition from darkness to sunlight is impressive.  Makes you fear the wild even more!

+\- Character customization tries to be really good, but everyone just looks varying shades of handicapped
+\- As of launch, Lag makes combat frustrating at times(Expected to settle by the weekend)
+\- Players are genuinly curious and eager to cooperate...until someone gets a gun.

-Graphics are either N64-tier or Witcher 3-tier.  While this is expected to be fixed and graphics are expected to be optimized, I can't make it a neutral because there's no time frame yet.  I'll update this review as things go along.
-Spawns are strange.  You will see a T-Rex or giant crocodile within seconds on one spawn, or you'll spawn in a paradise the next.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I know this is an alpha at the time of my writing this.

I know to expect lower performance, bugs, etc.

I also have a weak computer, and I know I'd have to lower settings.  Still, I can run quite a few good games with tweaking, so I figured I could run this.

But regardless...this is what the devs consider 'lowest settings' for the game.  (Using Low Memory options as well, even though my memory is not the weak part of my computer.)  https://twitter.com/CutieCharem/status/611775067463127041/  Yes, I'm sure the water reflections and quality, bloom, reasonably-long draw distance and more were all very much REQUIRED even for the lowest settings.  Just screw with the resolution and color quality and that's lowest settings, right devs?  :V  *sarcasm, if you couldn't tell*

I was lucky to even get that screenshot, the game froze my computer multiple times and I could barely turn the camera.  I didn't dare try moving around.

Is this game good, if you can get it to run?  Probably.  Will it improve as it gets out of early access?  Oh, almost certainly.  But I'm simply going off of my personal opinion of the game with this review.

And my opinion?  This this just another developer who worries about how good the game looks FAR before they at all give a crap about performance, and make it pretty clear they can't even comprehend the idea of a 'weaker specs' computer.  It's a trend that I'm getting steadily more and more annoyed at, and ARK's developers are just the latest offenders.  They care about the game drawing people in by its look and spectacle, and while there is likely a good game behind it, all the glitz makes it impossible for somebody in my position to find out.

Even if you have a great computer and you can run this game no-problem, wouldn't you like to see devs start caring about performance more?  You probably have friends you want to play this game with, but who can say if every one of them can run it?  There's many reasons why this practice - spectacle over performance - has got to stop.  And that's why I don't recommend this game.

For developers | There should be more counters to giga's on Primative servers and less rubber banding.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Well, to say the least about this game: Dinosaurs.

To actually give you something to think about, lets continue.

This is an incredibly interesting game, with many ups and downs. Not only does it allow for players to build their own bases, create their own clothing, and truly survive with dinosaurs prowling at your front door (if you built one),  it lets you build your own guns, explosives, and tame your very own Monster-Saurus-Rex!

But this game has a lot of draw-backs. The very first is that it is, in it's very basic form, tedious. For all of the hours I've logged, I'd say about 20% of them were interesting or exciting. The rest were me collecting rocks on the beach, or trying to find a server that didn't have some jerk with a machine-gun hunting down level 1 players.

Sure there are PVE servers, but not having anyone to fight takes literally all of the fun out of it. Who's going to blow open your compound and let loose a swarm of angry raptors? Not the enviroment. So you're left with two options; find a community that doesn't suck out of the sixty to seventy thousand servers out there, or find some friends who have the ability to host a server, and hope they have the money to support it for a while.

When you really get into it, it's a great game with lots to do and really interesting technical abilities. But until you REALLY get into it, it's the most tedious thing to do, and that's why I can't say it's worth a buy.
