reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThe trailer for this game looked amazing, and too good to be true.  I am a huge fan of early access survival games such as Rust, 7 Days to Die, H1Z1, etc. and have many hours logged on these games, so I was interested in seeing how Ark stacked up against them.  After Beast of Prey kind of flopped (in my opinion), I was hoping a survival game with dinosaurs would come along that was interesting and worth playing.  Well I am not disappointed!  At first I had the same troubles as everyone else, could not log in, etc.  But once I entered the game I was pleasantly surprised at the amount of character customization available, that the other survival games that have been out much longer still lack.  The graphics are amazing, though it is difficult to get good FPS right now on anything too high (I'm sure they need to optimize the game still).  The world is amazing, with the dinosaurs as a significant threat, a leveling system and building similar to that of Rust.  I can see myself spending many hours on this game and look forward to seeing how it progresses over time!

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis game is a TON of fun! Honestly, I don't care what the haters say about ARK... it's spectacular! Would recommend this game to anyone!

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nIf you are disappointed with early access games, buy this. The game play is extremely well thought out and plays like a full release. Well worth your money and it will possibly make you lose your job, house and significant other! The pace is very good, and well implimented, the level cap is high enough to keep you striving for leveling without being too grindy, you can poop, which is amazing and it is about time we can defecate in a survival game, loooong over due, updates are frequent and address issues, communication (so far) is very good from the dev team and they have already had a Q&A stream. This game not only has amazing potential, but has already paid for itself in entertainment, day 3 and I've already played 50 hours. Insane. The cons of the game right now, which in my opinion are very low, the FPS needs to be worked on, they have already said they are focusing on this, I would like to see some improvements in the crafting and sorting so it is easier to find things instead of scrolling, I would also like to see an optional disable chat box. This is all I can come up with cons. Very few, great game, BUY IT! Feel free to ask me any questions on my stream while I play. www.twitch.tv/thelyzardiam

Hey, Thanks for reading my review. I've been playing this game for a week now and i already can tell you these things:

Firstly, the children should stop crying about FPS... This game is in alpha mode and whenever you are about to buy it, it gives you a warning about these problems. I admit that the FPS in this game is horrible for some people (my fps was 10 with epic settings) but after going searching on internet i came across some good tips and after i did them i got about 30 fps everywhere on the map (the settings are all low but i dont care about look)

Secondly, I like this game becouse i can have progress and have a fun time playing with my friends. yes, on multiplayer you get killed every 20 minutes but i am not playing on officials or in servers with more than 20 players. This is a bit boring but its great for me becouse i can learn all the things of this game. I did not buy this game to murder people, instead i got it to explore a world full of dino's , get some house going on, hunting etc.

Thirdly, i can recommend you this game becouse i had so much fun this week playing it, it was only one week but my adventures were priceless. You come across Horde's of raptors, get munched by a Trex, get stomped by a Bronto. This all made me want to quit at first, but yeah... i learned not to die.

I hope this review helped you, if it did not im sorry.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I m really new to Multiplayer Role Playing Games. I purchased this as a gift for my son in law and then bought copies for 2 more family members and myself. I am fallen in love with the game, I can't stop playing it.  I love the many facets of building, gathering, hunting, survival, planning, working together as a tribe (family).  I love the choice to respawn where you want on the Island or the idea of respawning at the same place if you so chose.

I find that I am playing the game for 8 - 10 hours per day. I have only been playing for 2 weeks and I intend to continue as the game continues to present more and more challenges.  Considering it is my first game of this type I am amazed at how I am progressing.  Although there are things that I have to rely on my tribe to omplete as I gain experience I am able to complete the tasks as I develop.

There are some glitches yet.  The game will freeze occasionally, but this is expected as the game is in the development phase.  So if you are looking for a good time I recommend that you check ARK: Survival Evolved out.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I bought this game on June 6. Jumped onto an Oceanic Server after giggling at the abominations of avatars you can create if you wish(but setting for a perfectly normal, well-chiseled male with blonde hair) and spawned on the South- Eastern region of the map.

I learned you only want to punch trees long enough to make a stone pickaxe because it hurts. The more resource collecting I did, the hungrier and thirstier that I got. After 3 minutes of gathering basic resources I run into a pack of Dilos and die. I did respan close to where I started however so I got my stuff- and died to the pack again.

Next respawn I did was same zone, different spot. I managed to get to a camp fire with other fellow Aussies- trying to survive on this island. They even gave me meat to stop me from dying next to their camp fire.

I then decided to take my pick axe to a Stegosaurus at level 3 to try and get more meat. This game can be unforgiving at times, but its still awesome.

Wiser- my next respawn had me land near my original spot, I found my way back to the camp where I met the nice fellow who kept me alive- he abandoned the camp, so I set up my own camp a little further- provided food and shelter to other fellow survivors, watched them turn on each other over the 1 hatchet and 6 meat I gave to them both. Another player showed up after I killed the survivor and we started a tribe.

It is now nearly Thursday, our tribe is a good 11 people strong, we have 2 bases, I am building a third, and an out post in between. every night has brought in something new that has kept me pumping nearly 8 hours a day average since I have owned it.

Despite the fact that I had to upgrade my GPU just to play this game above 15fps on anything above minimum settings(R9 270 to R9 290X) and the fact that dinosaurs occasionally float into heaven after you kill them, making it hard to get meat and hide I am loving my first survival game that has stirred the slumbering child within. Smashing bases with trikes and fending off Carnos with naught but a spear is extremely fun and tense.

Not only would I recommend this game to everyone else- I ENCOURAGE them to buy the game and see how an early access game and development team SHOULD be- they patch frequently and are always communicating with us and responding to steam forums feedback and bug complaints

Do not go for PvE server. Why not? Join any of PvE server and after 5 minutes of wandering arround you gona get the point.
3. This is survival game. Choose option You like to play - Solo or with Friend or whatever. Just be cool stay cool and have fun.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

10 out of 10!!!

This is hands down the best game I've ever played and it still has ten and a half months of updates to go before final release!  This has all the elements of a 'crafting' game, first person shooter, and RPG.  The dynamic environment is an awe inspiring experience.  There's nothing more thrilling than walking in the forest and running into a large dinosaur that can end you quickly.  The ocean in this game terrifies me (it's deep and full of stuff that can kill you).  The visual and audio when under water is really well done.  The crafting is awesome and unique.  You go from basically throwing rocks to using an automatic rifle!  There are performance issues which are to be expected.  I can't wait for the months to come to see what else can be added to this beautiful game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I bought this game on June 6. Jumped onto an Oceanic Server after giggling at the abominations of avatars you can create if you wish(but setting for a perfectly normal, well-chiseled male with blonde hair) and spawned on the South- Eastern region of the map.

I learned you only want to punch trees long enough to make a stone pickaxe because it hurts. The more resource collecting I did, the hungrier and thirstier that I got. After 3 minutes of gathering basic resources I run into a pack of Dilos and die. I did respan close to where I started however so I got my stuff- and died to the pack again.

Next respawn I did was same zone, different spot. I managed to get to a camp fire with other fellow Aussies- trying to survive on this island. They even gave me meat to stop me from dying next to their camp fire.

I then decided to take my pick axe to a Stegosaurus at level 3 to try and get more meat. This game can be unforgiving at times, but its still awesome.

Wiser- my next respawn had me land near my original spot, I found my way back to the camp where I met the nice fellow who kept me alive- he abandoned the camp, so I set up my own camp a little further- provided food and shelter to other fellow survivors, watched them turn on each other over the 1 hatchet and 6 meat I gave to them both. Another player showed up after I killed the survivor and we started a tribe.

It is now nearly Thursday, our tribe is a good 11 people strong, we have 2 bases, I am building a third, and an out post in between. every night has brought in something new that has kept me pumping nearly 8 hours a day average since I have owned it.

Despite the fact that I had to upgrade my GPU just to play this game above 15fps on anything above minimum settings(R9 270 to R9 290X) and the fact that dinosaurs occasionally float into heaven after you kill them, making it hard to get meat and hide I am loving my first survival game that has stirred the slumbering child within. Smashing bases with trikes and fending off Carnos with naught but a spear is extremely fun and tense.

Not only would I recommend this game to everyone else- I ENCOURAGE them to buy the game and see how an early access game and development team SHOULD be- they patch frequently and are always communicating with us and responding to steam forums feedback and bug complaints

Make slingshot
Pickup rocks

Run away

Wait for him to almost starve to death
Give him food
*IMPORTANT*: If he is almost awake, bash his head some more with your spear.
If you feed him enough food while keeping him knocked out, he will love you
Very realistic"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Game is currently unplayable, the optimization is so bad that even a GTX 970 is not able to play the game at solid 60 frames at low graphics.

It's a fun game but at it's current state, you're barely able to play it. I hope they try to fix this instead of focusing on releasing new dinosaurs so that people can actually play the game.

UPDATE: 25. Dec, 2015:
- Did find it playable now around the 12th of december 2015. But still not recommended for purchase, really because it's still not well optimized for most people. Doing 40-60 frames on med-high as of now, with very little renderdistance.

- Other than the optimization, the game is fun and they do update often and hot-fix necessities, like a bug that happened with the boats where you float on them so that you move at a really slow speed, they did that the morning after (patch came out around 18:00 or so). AKA: Seems like they are keeping the game up to date, but we will have to remember it's still an early access; no it does not mean they don't have to optimize the game, but it means that the game is not yet complete.

Update 21. February 2016:
They made a huge update where they changed the dinosaur's health, damage and stats overall in the game, to the point where the dinosaurs are more or less useless and a fantastic addition to that, they added a super dinosaur"; the Giganotosaurus that completely makes PvP in the game unbalanced and ruins the entire purpose of having any dinosaurs beforehand. Game is definitely not something I would recommend as of now. Hope the devs picks up what people have been saying about the dino' nerf.

TL;DR: Dinosaurs are nerfed and bad. Which ruined the game entirely. Thanks."

In summary, terrible character customisation, terrible optimisation, terrible UI, terrible planning of habitats (you cant have all different animals everywhere, you think thats a ♥♥♥♥ing zoo?), terrible map for player, terribly over-priced, terrbible experience.  But fix this and this would be a good one to recommend, or else, lets suffer together.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I didn't have fun playing a game like this in a long time, played 110 hours in 2 weeks, last time i played that much was in my World of Warcraft days...

+An early access game with a dev team that actually updates and add content for the game, and tells you what they are working on.

+Graphics are amazing - The devs optimized the game, went from 25 fps to 70 fps on medium settings with my 970 - and they didn't even do the real optimization pass yet (since it's done at the release of a game and most likely followed by a nVdia/AMD driver update). Also the game is meant to be played on DX12 which isn't out yet.

+The Gameplay is unique, you level up and make choices on which kind of technology you want to learn, you dont get forced into a certian playstyle, you can either build a huge base or go out as a team and explore dungeons... or raid other people's bases, or just hangout in the wilds and tame some dinos !

- PvE servers are plagued by thatch houses left to rot for 18 days before you can destroy them... it really feels weird walking around the shore and only seing thatch houses everywhere.

- PvP servers are meant for GROUPS of people who do not fear losing their belongings, so many people whining because they got robbed, please, it's the darn goal of a PvP server.

This game feels better than most of the recent AAA games that are coming out...
It's an EA and to me, it already is a very good game as it is.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I'll start this review by just saying I recommend buying this game, it is a good investment of money. The devs update it frequently, too.

There's a lot to do in ARK. You can level up, build a big wooden base and venture out to stab Dodos with a spear for fun. You can do the same thing but on a PVP server and stab people in the face with a spear for fun. You can punch a Raptor in the face, knock it out, feed it narcoleptic drugs and then feed it a ton of meat to drug it and brainwash it into being tamed. You can then have it follow you around and fight things with you or even put a saddle on it and ride it.

You can absolutely mangle your character in the character creator, too. It's fun. I made a character that looked like Smough from Dark Souls (weird neck included) but with tiny little arms. You can also paint your house and dye your clothing bright purple or yellow if you want. Oh and you can develop a single-shot rifle from scratch and shoot people in the face from in your bright purple base.
I think the only issue it really has is that it runs a little ♥♥♥♥♥♥ and needs a bunch more optimisation. But that's minor if you have a good rig anyway.

Great game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I am a simple man.... A simple man with simple Interests, simple dreams and simple pleasures.

I am interested in dinosaurs and hitting things with other things.
I dream of riding raptors into battle against other dinosaurs.
Realizing my simple dreams pleases me.
ARK has done this for me.  ARK wins.

Now I have to get a disclaimer out of the way.  I have never really been into survival" games before and while I like the Idea of PvPvE I am opposed to how most of the PvP plays out in these kind of games
date:
I'll talk about that a little later.  My perspective of (at this point ) 158 hours of game play is entirely on a private server with default server settings playing with a small group of my friends as one big tribe.


ARK is early access
recommended: but it is gorgeous for that.  At 6 weeks after it's release the Devs have been incredibly attentive and are rolling out patch after patch.  Performance issues are improving (admittedly still not up to most peoples standards but it takes time)
hoursPlayed: Content is being added steadily
voteText: bugs are being squashed.  It's as impressive an Early access game as any I've seen at this stage.  If they can keep this pace and quality up this is going to turn into an amazing finished game and not just and amazing beta.  That said even right now if the optimization was a little bit better I'd consider the $30 price tag well worth the price even if they added nothing else.\n\nI love the atmosphere of the game
helpfulPercent: I love the feelings it evokes
votesHelpful: I love that even reaching level 62 in my time in game so far I haven't explored but a fraction of the island and am still concerned for my safety any time i wander more than 5 minutes from my base.  The island can feel open an majestic then claustrophobic and menacing and
votesTotal: if you are like me
votesFunny: the ocean (full of giant sharks) is just nightmare fuel.  There is a pervading sense of dread that sinks in after the first time you are murdered by a raptor in the dark you didn't see coming and in your panic couldn't run or fight that helps with the immersion.  You huddle to light sources
commentsCount: you build fires everywhere
column16: the darkness becomes your enemy as you are naked and alone
column17: and even when you are well armed and armored being alone in the dark is more than enough to cause a jump every time you hear "stomp stomp stomp" but can see the source.  There is a long term learning curve that tells you as soon as you get cocky and consider yourself safe a Carno or T-Rex (or even a herd of sabertooth tigers) is just going to show up and eat you.  That is where to me the game shines
column18: it's not that it never gets easier it's that something can always seem to go wrong if you get complacent and that's where I like my challenge.  I mean by it's mechanics and atmosphere tribe play doesn't just make things easier
column19: you literally feel better having a second set of eyes around when doing anything.  Speaking of Tribe play...\n\nThe mechanics of the Game encourage cooperation in a way I really appreciate.  It is literally impossible for one player to unlock all of the Engrams (crafting recipes) available in the game.  You need at least one partner.  Division of labor is built into the game and that's not even taking into account that resource gathering for even the most basic of structures goes from prohibitive to reasonable with helping hands.  This is NOT minecraft where you can build wonders of the world single handedly with little trouble
column20: this is a game where you really should cooperate with someone to build anything of note and progress and I really do like that.  The further fact that Food and Water concerns are ever present make the survival elements come to the fore
column21: you are never going to be completely free to just collect wood and build stuff you must take care of yourself (and your pets) or you will die to the most voracious predators on the island
column22: hunger and thirst).  To me that has made the challenge remain.  It tethers me to water sources
column23: it makes me plane my expeditions around my food supply
column24: it helps with my immersion.  In addition to biological needs
column25: getting lost in the process of construction won't stop the local wildlife from snacking on you so even just having someone around to literally just keep watch is valuable and that kind of fundamental teamwork encouraged by core mechanics is something I appreciate. Taming Dinos has become my new Hobby
column26: riding dinos
column27: capturing them
column28: scheming new ways to make taming easier.... this is where i have found my joy
column29: my tribe currently had a herd of 84 tamed animals (17 Raptors alone) many captured primarily by me r with my assistance that speaks to my enjoyment of the concept
column30:
and that's just one way to lose countless hours of time.

As i said I am playing exclusively PvE at this point.  I have no interest in the way much PvP in this genre is played.  I see no reason to involve my self in something where for no other reason than spite once you've beaten someone you erase hundreds of hours of their work.  That's my opinion and I don't expect everyone to agree with that BUT I do know many do.  The upside is that you don't have to play PvP at all if you want and I think there is some promise in "limited" PvP pr PvP with "rules of war" that will allow everyone to stay friends after a major engagement.  I'm interested in seeing where it goes bu t I have not participated in PvP in ARK at this point.  I do think interaction between tribes could be interesting and i look forward to seeing how that shapes up on my server if and when it happens.

Now lets talk about draw backs: Primarily it's Early access which means it's incomplete and runs not as well as it could.  that's the biggest thing.  You've got weird rag dolling
column31: funky physics in places
column32: clipping issues
column33: some weird to flat out bad animal pathing
column34: low frame rates at times and odd graphical artifacts can be immersion breaking.  But all of that is stuff that is presumably being worked on by the devs in there multiple a week patches.  I wish the process of taming was a bit more varied and challenging but then I have spent the vast majority of my time in ARK taming one creature or another so it may just be over familiarity
column35: I just wish it was a little more interactive. I find that rolling out of camp with a pack of half a dozen animals makes you pretty unstoppable but i'm hoping stat balancing works that out a bit.   All in all i don't have a lot bad to say right now.\n\nBottom line i love this game.  In three weeks I've put up nearly 160 hours while working a full time job as well
column36: you could say I'm pretty hooked.  I've done it all playing with friends in a PvE environment and I haven't even come close to running out of things I can or want to do in game.  The game is very very viable in a PvE environment
column38: immersive and one can only imagine going to get better.  If you like dinosaurs
column39: are interested at all in survival games
column40:
or both you should really try ARK.

And if that didn't sell you try this:

At some point you will be able to arm your friends with assault rifles you made yourself

Well with both games set at 1280x720 with graphics on lowest I can pull 80-70 frames on Rust, were as Ark I can bearly get it over 30 god damn fps.  I run both these games on an Asus G75V with the gtx 670mx, 32gb ddr3 ram and an I7 3630QM that get's 2.40 Ghz.

So overall if you are looking for a game in this sort of genre I recommend you try Rust, because it is cheaper and just a better game in general in my opinion.

So overall if you are looking for a game in this sort of genre I recommend you try Rust, because it is cheaper and just a better game in general in my opinion.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I don't recommend this game as it is but instead encourage people to wait for it to be finished. But honestly other than dinosaurs this game doesn't have much. And even the dinosaurs are painful becuase you juat sit around waiting for rhe dinos to tame. The building system is alright. Everything is tied to grind. Progression through levels feels uninspired and you barely notice it. Their talent system us called engrams and let's you make buildings armor weapons and various devices and things for utility. While this seems cool, in practice it just means you need to keep in reserve the points you need in order to build or make what you want later and don't waste points on frivolity. Some have prerequisites in order to make you feel like there is some sort of system but really it is just boring. And then they have blueprints anyway which can sometimes make better versions of stuff...at which point you feel like you've wasted engram points....

Tribal warfare only exists briefly...generally an order develops on the server and alliances and pvp becomes boring...no one wants to lose the lvl 100+ rex or giga in a raid for the most part and killing other players quickly turns you into a pariah since they report who killed you or what killed you...

Lastly...I have a nice computer. I can run max settings and have a greater than 20 fps. That being said, the game is buggy. Often I'll be running along and suddenly I'll be back 10 feet where I'd already been. Different settings do not stop this because I tried putting everything on low.

If you do decide to play just play on a pve server. Official pvp servers are only fun messing with your reiterates and even that has its ups and downs. Pvp is a nightmare that is more theatrical than American politics.

I will say the modding is nice but that is an built in ability of the unreal tournament engine for the most part. Other than dinos I'd say this game lacks heart. They keep trying to make more and more content with uninspired gameplay mechanics.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Yes, I would recommend this game.
First of all, the graphics are outstanding and give a very beautiful contrast to the world around you. The world just feels alive with moving leaves, grass, and breathing dinosaurs that roam the surface. There is much detail on everything and everyone in the game too.

The combat is unique and gives you a wide variety of weapons to choose from like swords and shields to guns and crossbows. The game has an actual difficult challenge in so many ways, example: Taming a dinosaur can take up hours to complete. Just be careful though of the bloodthirsty carnivores that might kill your unconscious dinosaurs that you're trying to tame.

It's not easy surviving in ARK, you have to take care of thirst, hunger, temperature, torpor, health, and oxygen. This will also apply to your dinosaurs. You can choose between first or third person view and nice inventory GUI's. Many dinosaur types including birds, reptiles, mammals, amphibians, arachnids, etc. There's so much to cover, but that would take hours.

One thing to keep in mind, you need a great computer because ARK is a very marvelous game.

Early Access Review

Such an easy review to write... This game is not even finished yet, not even close to optimized yet, and still well within early release yet it is already by far the best dinosaur game I have ever seen for PC or anywhere else.
It needs work but the devs are active and know it needs work.
In its unfinished state its awe inspiring. Buy this title or miss out big time...
Beware if you cannot handle Player vs. Player aciton because thats likely what you will run into. I am not a fan of random player killing myself but this game is actually so good it is worth the anoyance to me...
1-the survival is done very well.
2- the crafting is done very well.
3- the world and its resources is done very well.
4- the dinos and other creatures are fun yet challenging.
5- the crafting and carry weight are done well.

NOW all these things NEED to and WILL BE optimized before release yet are all still playable now...

I highly recomend this title. an island with up to 70 players and I hardly see anyone and very few waste their time trying to rob or eat me. Yes there is a chance you will be eaten by another player or WORSE if you can believe it LOL.
Great game! BUY IT NOW

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is both a Yes and a No recc.

I've had my eye on the game for quite a while now and decided, on a whim, it purchase it earlier today. It downloaded very quickly and I was excited to try it. Unfortunately, with a steady 3-8 fps on all 8 servers I tried, both official and unofficial, I didn't get off the beach. However, I did manage to get to level 4 so there is that.

Good..

Graphics are excellent and very attractive
Decent character customisation
Loads of skills to learn
Lots of things to do even on the Newbie beach
Interesting skill tree

Bad...

Great graphics kill with a low fps
Not enough character customisation
Couldn't work out how to get a decent character view point.
Too many key bindings to remember... essential to print out the info and have it infront of you when you play.
Unable to adjust settings enough to be able to get enough fps to actually play the game properly which was extremely disappointing, especially as I tried numerous tricks recc'd on Youtube and Forums.
Game mucked around with my computer too much, freezing it up so badly that I had to do 4 manual restarts in 30 minutes, even opening a browser would make the game freeze.

Although I have asked for a refund from Steam, I will be keeping my eye out for the official version as I really do want to play the game... but not as it is now... it's just got too many problems.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Launched the game for the first time, made my generic burly character and spawned in ontop of a prehistoric crocodile which promptly ate me. Next up spawned in again ran around, punched a tree and got thatch and wood then proceeded to run around. punched a dodo to death....yea feels good to be at the top of the food chain wait whats that.....eaten by a carnosaur.

My experience with this game has been a varied one so far, my second day playing this i spent 2 hours trying to launch the game with nothing but infuriating crashes however during that time i noted that the makers of the game released 4 patches to try and fix various errors, although this didn't resolve my problem by the 3rd day they had fixed the insta crash issue. Although i do still get the occasional crash. You have to remember that this game only came out a couple of days ago and so far everytime i log onto steam the makers have launched another update... something i have rarely seen an early access publisher do.

The gaming experience is great again not optimized so it will probably run sub par on your computer even if you have a good rig however theres ways to get around it, i found reducing the ground clutter to help tremendously. However i have yet to find a game which will push my rig as much as this has, I don't know if its because its un optimized but i can't play with anything on high ( so far every game i have played I can max out on 1080p )....despite this it still looks amazing

The game itself is fun, theres something about running around on an island  filled with prehistoric beasts that makes this survival game really click. Your first couple of tries will probably result in you getting eaten,drowned or hacked to death by one of the other players but its when you start to survive that this game comes into its own. you slowly start to build up your hut, tame your first dinosaur. its all really great fun especially if you have a tribe to share your achievements with.

Again the game is early access and with any early access game you should be cautious however the makers have shown dedication and if they continue to I don't see why ARK: Survival Evolved would not become the apex survival game

10 / 10 would punch a dinosaur in the face again

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is really great!
It is very computer heavy though, at this point.. but there are several launch options available to help out.
The premise of being dumped in your undies in a land populated by dino's is well layed out. I even can understand the 'whatever's' dropping supplies that you can gather. Its a lot of fun at lower levels when dino's are scary and the world is harsh.
THEN:
Along comes mid levels. Welcome to another advanced tech shooter game.
You go instantly from preserving meat in a smoking bin to making firearms up to and including automatic weapons in your stone and coal smelter with a tiny little smith table. Electricity and gasoline to power your geni's..
At that point, if your not on a decent server.. welcome to RUST with Dino's.
100% Good game if they left the advanced tech out.
Still totally worth it, and a GREAT game if you play on a server without the interference of Grief or Trolls.
So for now, because of the advanced tech.. 90% in love with it.
A plus also.. You can solo play and live just you vs the dino's.. or host your own...
If your rig can run it.. GET IT

EDIT: Now 11/21/2015 I gave up on this at all now, except for solo play. Where you can mod the game out, and crank the difficulty to levels of real fun. Keeps you interested while alone. As the devs continued to add advanced tech, this game just slipped farther and farther away from any remote fun at all for me online. If you didnt start out early and get a good tribe built up, boasting all the latest in modern gear and all the must have dino's your pretty much screwed starting out now. For me, it really slipped to just another impossible stretch of imagination for the sake of killing everyone. Which to be honest, would have been great fun, minus the advanced tech. If it could had stayed cavemen maybe getting up to muskets tops, awsome.. As in now, just another pure kill em all with total war chaos boasting machine guns and it all.... with dino's on the side.  Solo is still a ton of fun, I use a zero advance tech mod, and recently found one that adds in NPC humans with no advanced tech also. So now for me, its cavemen surviving other cavemen and dino's.. minus machine guns and weapons of mass destruction crafted with pixie dust and bubblegum in a stone fireplace.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Incredible game:D Wether you take your Dilophosaurus for a stroll or watch a sunset turfwar, danger lurks everywhere and every 50 ft you'll need to stop and look around at the beautifull prehistoric sights!:P

+Decent Survivaling, uses alot when doing alot, uses little when you enjoy the enviroment!
+Teaming up is fairly easy and fun, community seems to easilly team up with strangers:)
+Crafting and building is fun, and people have made quite a few cool buildings etc.
+Almost all unofficial servers seem to have the policy that your dinos may not be killed by others when you are offline, and everyone understands.
+Map feels very large but detailed, with many alcoved and other places hidden in plain sight. lots of proper base-locations.

+/- taming a dino is very cool. its hard(and it should be), takes a while, needs materials and is sensitive to griefers. But when you manage, you get the coolest companions! Both big AND small:D

-had some mayor login-isseus, but most seem to be fixed now
-Doesnt run too smooth on 4mb and lower machines. if your pc is crap, dont get this(should be obvious tho)

After 200+ hours ingame i can add the following:

I used to play 5 different games, now all i play is ark. its not out of nececity, but out of sheer enjoyment! i keep finding new projects to play with, im absolutely in love with the basebuilding, and im currently on a great server with everyone being a decent pvp community. no grief/base-leveling, or dino-killing during raids, and alot of fun rp-ish comms with other tribes in between, its hella fun. (if you feel you want to join this sort of community, add me to steam and ask about it;p)

Out of all the hundreds of survival games i simply find this one to be most complete in what i want from it. I still need to make sure i eat and drink at max lvl, but it becomes easy to manage it, and after 200 hours ingame, there is still pve content that i want/need to do. The devs are really on top of updates and new content, patching every day still, AND adding new content every week!

my conclusion: Play it. They added loads of options for low-gear pc's, and even on low graphix(as im forced to play so, since my pc isnt the best) its a beautifull world. well-balanced, decent community, and loads of content!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The game looks amazing, the community is horrible, the game plays horrible. Unreal egnine really makes the graphics pop, the water is beautiful, the GUI is impressive, everything is minimalistic and unintruding. The graphics and everything related to it, I mean this game just has it down to a perfection. It's incredibly difficult to believe the game is still in early access. Till you play it...or watch youtube videos on it...You start to wonder..Am I lagging? Okay wtf, now I'm just stuttering around like a ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ chimp!

I have an R295x2. I stutter with the lowest graphics and memory settings, also the highest and everything inbetween. If I can't play this game, neither the hell can you.

There's nothing about this game that I don't love in terms of gameplay. The crafting is simple, new, and a rather quick then slow progression all of which can advance yourself to weapons, clothes and all for you or your tribe. Building and structures are impressive, simple designs but ones that look and rather feel real and beg to be touched. The dinosaur AI are impressive and annoying. Whether it be from watching a Rex hunt down another dinosaur or Dilos attacking you...There's always an interesting sight to behold as well to annoy you. Taming could be better, but once you're airborne you just never want to look back.

I can honestly say if it wasn't for the horrible unoptimized gameplay, I would not have gotten a refund. Yes that's how bad it is, I actually got a refund and yet praise this game. Gameplay and graphics are truly amazing, BUT when I can't even open my inventory for 5 minutes because the game is stuttering like a ♥♥♥♥♥ in confession...EVERY TIME. It doesn't matter how good it looks and feels.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Summary: Can't say I'm impressed. Game looks pretty decent, wows with dinosaur riding, and other niceness, but all depends on you being able to get there. Started a game on a PvP server and found it incredibly difficult to get started - something that seems to be by design, or lack thereof. It didn't improve with moving to PvE servers.

---

Joined a PvP server. There's no real tutorial for noobs - which is fine - but the curve is quite steep if you spawn in the wrong part of the map. If you're not killed by a dino you're shuffled off the mortal coil by a bored high-level player. Again, this would be fine if you didn't have to start entirely from scratch every time you die. I could just suck at the game (and I probably do) but the mechanics seem to be very heavily skewed towards higher-level characters, or certainly those who bought the game closer to its EA debut. At this point I thought I'd switch to a PvE server, to at least try and remove one of the harbingers of a swift demise.

Yet another issue - suppose you decide you don't like a server - an opinion which might take a little time to form as your initial impressions will largely be the same on most servers: die a lot trying to stave off starvation and get on the real" tech ladder. You decide you don't like it after a few hours
date: and want to switch to a friendlier server - except your character is locked to the server
recommended: and I have found no transfer function from server to server - even like-to-like. Bit of a dampener.\n\nSO
hoursPlayed: I transferred to a few PvE servers. The story was similar on all the ones I tried
voteText: but one in particular stuck with me: I spawned on a beach
helpfulPercent: as per usual
votesHelpful: and started trying to scratch my way up the miserable and depressing end of the tech chain. When it came to place my first item (a camp fire to cook with)
votesTotal: it turned out I was forbidden from placing it on any place across the entire map.\n\nI asked on the chat what the deal was (someone was kind enough to reply between shouts of "I NEEEEEEED NARCOS")
votesFunny: and apparently because the map had been peppered with structures  by other players to prevent such a thing
commentsCount: you're not allowed to place items within x distance of another player placed structure.\n\nSo let's phrase that slightly differently. You're allowed to join a server
column16: but as long as you understand that you will be doomed to roam around like a tool in your cave-boxers
column17: because those who came before (and not the cool kind from AC) have locked down all but the high-level areas of the map. So instead of high-level players killing me before I can make progress
column18: any old player who's been there longer has prevented me (and you
column19: if you buy this) from making progress in a much more insidious way.\n\nI'm sure I'm probably coming across as a butt-hurt noob
column20: and maybe I am
column21: but I then thought "no
column22: there'll be provision for me
column23: somewhere - surely the devs plan for the fact that their user base will grow?" So

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is an Early Access review of this game, please keep this in mind, I will not be using this as an excuse for its negatives but it means that the issues will most likely be worked on in the future.

This game is basically rust with dinosaurs. Like, no lie, that's exactly what it is.  If you don't know what rust is, basically you gather materials by hitting them, then use those materials to build bases and other weapons, armour, tools and objects to better your chances at survival.

Pros:

. Graphics - It's a beautiful game for early access, it looks a lot better than ''the stomping land'' but it is defiantly not up to par with newer games. Even so it has had great art direction and the dinosaur models + animation are good.

. Fun.

. Addicting - I have only played for 7 hours so far and I feel like I haven't even scratched the surface of things to do in this game, getting enough gear to survive against other humans and dinosaurs is great, and taming dinosaurs is really fun and rewarding.

. Persistent levelling - when you die you don't lose all of your levels. I really like this as it takes away a trolling incentive for people to kill players, you don't start to get things worth stealing until you are a much higher level (at least 5 hours into it) and by that point you can defend yourself.

. You can ride dinosaurs.

. Dinosaurs.

Cons:

. Low fps - this game is not well optimized yet and causes even high end computers to suffer in some situations

. Map leaks and clipping issues - the map needs work and more optimisation, you can also get stuck in trees and see through the map at some points.

. Underwater design needs a lot of work, as well as swimming and underwater dinosaurs seem to common, you can't safely swim from one side of a river to another without getting eaten by a Megalodon.

. It's Unrealistic drinking water from the ocean to get your dehydration level up. It would be nice if they made it go down a little less and then added freshwater resources but this really just annoys me, I'm unsure if it annoys other people too.

. Server load times need improving.

These cons are most likely to be fixed as they update the game practically every day since I have had it, even if these things don't get fixed, this game is very fun and is certainly the best dinosaur survival game out there and I would recommend it for the price.

Thank you for reading my review! <3
voteText: 10 of 15 people (67%) found this review helpful 2 people found this review funny

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is really coming along well now. Lots of updates and it has some pretty addictive gameplay. The game has terrible optimization atm, but it is Early Access and in most games the bulk of the optimization happens later on. I expect this issue to be improved alot over the games development. That is really my only issue with the game so far is the bad optimization, other than that is is a joy to play.

The first 3-4 hours I was not sure about this game, but it has improved nicely already with updates that happens often and as I have learned more about the game the joy as skyrocketed. The game does crafting and building very well to, I have had a blast just building bases and crafting a ton of things, along with fighting dinos and scavaging.

So far atm it is without a doub much more enjoyable than H1Z1 and Rust. Good gameplay, Dinos that you can kill or tame (and ride around), a great leveling up system and devs that update the gam very often. So far so good, if you don't mind some crap optimization (which to be honest happens in a good amount of early access/alpha games until later in development) then pick this up! It is a real joy to play with friends! At first I was thinking a thumbs down because of the optimization but there is so much this game does well that it gets thumbs up after around 20 hours of gameplay. I will update this review later on.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

ARK: Survival Evolved could be a great game in future, but now, it's just another bad optimalised game. The basic concept of this game is good - As a man or woman, you must survive on island full of dinosaurs. You must craft tools, build a house, keep yourself warm, tame a dinosaur... Honestly, I would be satisfied with this, if that game worked for me. Truth is, I don't have the newest computer, but yet... when I can play the Witcher 3 on lowest settings with 40-60 FPS, why do I play this on lowest settings with 10-30FPS?

Pros+
+Great concept of this game
+Taming dinosaurs
+Things to do/not to do to survive (you must look for food, water, you can get tired very fast, you can break your leg...)
+Dinosaur species are very accurate
+ Good when playing with friends

Cons-
-BAD OPTIMALISED (FPS drops, low FPS, lags, slow loading...) - And for me, thanks to this issues, it's unplayable. I'm looking forward to better optimalisation, but I am not going to play it in near future. Maybe one day, when it will be released and I won't have time for it, it could be great. This disappointed me really much.
-Technical issues
-When you join new server, you must create a new character - If there would be option to transfer your character to different servers, I would like it. Also, having more characters would be good too, if there was that first option.
-Character customization is awful. You only can change color of your skin, if you will be fat or slim, tall or short, color of hair, color of eyes, and that would be all. There is nothing like changing different hairstyles, beards(in case of male character, obviously) and other details. That would be great

What can I say... If you want to buy this, yeah, buy it, but don't be disappointed. If I could give you my advice - buy it, when they will fix the technical issues or when it will be released and it's price will be reduced.

6.5/10, because it has a great potential

Review will be updated.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

UPDATE:  With more time under my belt - the game is still fun...  The Devs have released a plethora of patches to fix various performance and gameplay issues, but it still has a ways to go - especially along the optimization front.  However, I'm having fun working my way up to a brontosaurus burger (hopefully) while building out my own little village.
=========================================

This is a very tentative yes - normally I wouldn't really recommend an Early Access game that isn't close to being finished (I've even gone back and changed reviews for this very reason) - however...  One hour in the game (singleplayer) was rather fun - it is sort of what I'd imagine a modern (realistic) Minecraft (modded of course) game to be.  I like the crafting, I like the open world, I like the mobs (dinos), and unlike a lot of people - I've had no issues running the game.

Again, I've only played singleplayer so far and my graphics are set to high, but with some changes - some of the recommended ones from the devs in the forums.  No crashes, no errors of any sort, and only the odd pause when opening up my inventory or accessing an item's inventory, but the devs have stated that the game is not optimized yet.

If you like crafting, survival games, or dinosaurs, then I would say check out the forums to see which systems seem to be having the fewest issues, and then if your system falls into that category get this game.  If not, then I'd say wait until the patches start rolling in before you buy.

For the curious - I'm running the following:

Win 8.1
i7-4770k
16 gb ram
GTX 780

reviewText:
Early Access Review

So I was granted press access to ARK and I'm going to give my honest impressions of the CURRENT structure of the game. I will update this in the coming days as the game goes live and I assume gets patched.
TLDR
Game has some major potential and is more polished then most games in this genre (but that's not saying much) it has a lot of depth and a lot to do and a wonderful non procedurally generated world. Downsides, server stability is awful, optimization could be better, 30 ♥♥♥♥ING FPS CAPPED... Dino AI makes DayZ zombies look like geniuses.
Crafting/Gathering
The current crafting/gathering system is quite basic but it does work, you gather random things through the forest like berries and fibre, and then you can use tools/punch trees and rocks for other resources. You do not need crafting benches or anything to create items but there is a level system where you buy" blueprints with your level points. on average you can buy around 2-4 blueprints per character level and these grant you access to make anything from clothes to house materials. You build this on the fly assuming you have the required materials and can quene up 5 items at a time and still walk around.
Inventory
Inventory system is weight based not item based which is nice
date: however the UI is pretty damn confusing right now but not awful\nSurvival\nCharacter have a hunger/thirst meter and thirst does go down very quickly but food seems very fair
recommended: you'll need to kill one dino for meat every 30 minutes or so and cook it
hoursPlayed:
you gain hydration by simply jumping in the water.
Combat
Combat is extremely buggy right now mostly because of server instability and the animations are nothing short of hilarious. Ranged combat works quite well actually and the slingshot will definitely be your friend early game.
Dinosaurs
Dinosaurs EVERYWHERE this reminds me more of a mmo with mob spawns than a survival game. Right when you walk in you'll see the world is extremely populated with dinos
voteText:
pretty much everywhere you walk you'll be stepping on one. this makes gathering quite easy but kind of ruins the atmosphere as it feels very unrealistic. Most dinos are not aggressive until you attack them but obviously carnivours will attack.
Building
Building in the game is basically just like rust/reign of kings. Pieces snap together and have a health meter and can be destoryed. There sleeping bags/chests and more complex things like auto turrets later down the level tree.
Leveling
Leveling in this game is done by pretty much any action
helpfulPercent: gathering levels you
votesHelpful: killing things
votesTotal:
building ect. You lose all loot on death but not your level/blueprints.
Taming
Taming is a very cool system where you pretty much beat an animal into submission and when it's exhausted you feed it and it magically likes you and you can put a saddle on it. Cetain dinos are better at some things than another. Some are good for carrying heavy loads others are good for combat or flying. Overall this is probably the coolest system of the game as you can own as many dinos as you can tame.
Ending thoughts
ARK is as good as the trailer for the game but they hid a lot of the issues
votesFunny:
below is a video of some of my first steps and you can see there are glitches and server stability issues. Dino AI is dumb as terds which can leave dino combat not very engaging. I however really enjoyed my first few hours and highly recommend this title AS LONG as you acknowledge it is definitely early access and does need a lot of work. I personally feel there are no game breaking bugs though and for 25 dollars it's a steal. My biggest concern is how good the hack protection is on release.
Here is some gameplay if you prefer that over a wall of text. I explain a lot of the mechanics as well as show some funny moments.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tBZUMAAROBk"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Awesome game! You can gather wood, rocks, fiber, tons of berries, and thatch! You can build amazing structures with most of these materials so you feel right at home as well! Then you can go to play the next day and you are dead. You can harvest metal to make some awesome weapons. Then you can play the next day and not have anything! I had built this huge structure as a base with spike walls around it, went to sleep feeling good, feeling safe. The next day, I was dead and all my materials and most of my structure were gone! Best experience ever!

I recommend this game to people who love a challenge. The mechanic that keeps your body in game while you log out is just top notch, no other game has such a high quality realistic mechanic. If you can play LITERALLY 24/7 this game is for you!

11/10 would play again!

p.s. INB4 people learn sarcasm.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Game goes like this:

Create character, choose location, spawn in and spend time looking around and scratching your arm where you are unable to move or act and a random carnivore starts to chase you, if you lucky enough for it to be far enough away before you stop scratching your arm and looking around then you actually live to try outrun it and inevitably run into something else just as deadly... usually this is not the case - before you are able to move you are one hit by said carnivore.

Sometimes you are lucky enough to spawn in a less dangerous area, like maybe in the snow where you quickly catch a cold and die.

If you are lucky enough not to die by one of the 2 ways above then you probably will get stuck in the ground and have to wait till you die of starvation in order to randomly spawn again and probably die by one of the above.

If you still manage to survive all of these things then lets talk about combat - you manage to make a spear and try hunt something in order not to die of starvation, you find something low enough lvl you can probably kill, but unfortunately even though you are playing on a server where your ping is between 30 and 60 the animal teleports about and your miss stabs turn into exhaustion and you fall asleep, the animal then kills you while you tor-por".

I tried returning this game after playing it for 8 hours because I found it buggy and unplayable when I got stuck in the ground (and there is no unstuck command or suicide - I even tried eating spoiled meat and my own feces) but they refused.

So I thought what the hell ill give it another go - guess what.. nope still a pile of feces.

would definitely not recommend."

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI don't get why everyone loves this game so much. The game is so poorly optimized, you won't get over 30 fps. I don't care how good your system is, it simply won't run well. And it doesn't even look good. It looks like a mediocre xbox game. The gameplay is alright, kinda fun once you get some stuff set up and begin to get how the game works, but its impossible to kill most of the predators in the game unless you have very good weaponry (and no lag, which is impossible) These predators will chase you down halfway across the island and keep after you even after they are so far away you can't even see them anymore. Taming animals sucks because you have to wait beside the animal for almost 10 minutes feeding it berries, all the while, you are starving, freezing, and predators are trying to kill you. Only a few animals are actually worth taming, the rest will be useless to you. When you start the game, you prety much have to stay on the beach, because if you go inland you will be eaten within the minute, and the beach is extremely boring. There is nothing to do except collect the same 4 resources until a raptor appears and eats you. Now lets get to my least favorite part about the game: restarting. Every time you die, you restart with nothing. It takes about an hour to do anything remotely satisfying or meaningful and you will die before that happens. Even if you manage to survive for a while, if you close the game, you will lose everything. So unless you like playing for 10+ hours at a time, you will never move beyond stone tools. It's a ♥♥♥♥♥♥ survival game and a ♥♥♥♥♥♥ game overall. A good idea with a lot of potential but playing the game is more tedious than fun

reviewText:
Early Access Review

im aware that this game is Early Access(alpha/beta), so i WILL change this review when its released.

the game is hostile towards players, but it IS the first online survival game i've play'd that actually have friendly players. i've seen more friendly faces than hostile, but with that said, alot of bases are getting raided so NEVER play alone.

when i said the game is hostile, i ment that you can't trust you own home.. if you try to sleep on wooden or tatch floor, you'll fall trough and sufficate.. so you have to build a 2nd floor to fix this. the other thing that had me quit the game, was the server reset.. with no warning or way to award players who built a kingdom.. all buildings were removed, all dinos were lost, all your item were gone.. and you were dead. the only thing anyone got to keep was the level and the stuff you've learnd to build.

let me stress this.. to build a spear.. you need 10 wood, doesnt sound too bad.. to build a floor, you need 80! and for 1 wall 40.. of course, thats not it alone, you'll need some more stuff aswell.. and you can build metal stuff too, which is hard to get, specially when other players BLOCK cave entrance with metal buildings that can only be broken with explosive which you wont get cause you're in need of metal to make them!

the dinos are tamable and its fun to hunt for them, but my GOD does it take time to tame them.. a stegosaurus takes 2-2.5 hours and this is average time.. i cant stress it enough how STUPID that is.. cause after you've tamed it, theres nothing that prevent others from killing it. unless you got a base with walls around, its not safe to keep a dino. and yet again, i dont know how many times the server have had a reset or will reset, so thinking that it takes around 4 hours to tame a bronto.. well there you go.. 4 hours of your time completely wasted..

i know the intention of this game was great, and in theory, it would've been one of the best games.. but thats all it will be  in theory.. you can put your heart into every move you take, but other players can really screw you over when youre offline.. because your character is asleep in the game at that time, so anyone can take your stuff, kill you or ruin your entire work..

like i said, once the game is not player hostile, i'll change this review

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Really fun game. I get annoyed at the people that are allowed to kill me--level 20-somethings that can wipe a level-5. And the servers are full--Why buy this when I have to start a new character every night?

The above was from last night.
This morning, we try to login to find EVERYTHING we built was completely wiped. We couldn't even try and protect it last night!

I don't recommend. At least until they make it better.


Since our crap was destroyed this AM we decided to switch servers. Again, killed by a level 18 or something while I'm a 3. Annoying. I resurrect right inside a building--so I can't get out now.

It's been a while since I edited, so here's a new update:

It seems more about the server. Some servers are just jerks. Others seem nicer. You still end up with a few jerks, but at least now we can play without having to rebuild everything every night (knock on wood).
The game still glitches oddly--was riding a Sarco and kept landing directly on top of a pike fence. He died in seconds; even though I was going backwards.

It's getting better but still not quite there. Recommend would be a Maybe" but since it isn't an option

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I was lucky enough to be part of a group invited to the early stages of the Alpha. I have had experience in this game for about a week and have made some observations.

Performance is terrible at the moment, however over the last week the developers have listened to testers and have been acting on feedback with quick and effective patches. Performance is much better now than it was a week ago and I can only see this improving over time, at this point it would appear the biggest complaint has been performance. A little patience and in the coming weeks I am sure that this will improve.

The game current features heaps of content, a great leveling system and encourages group play well. The caves are fantastic fun and I hope to see more of this content added to the game. There are some balance issues and recently based on tester feedback the development team has made some great changes and I expect more to come.

The only thing I don't like is character creation. While there are a heap of options to customise your look some of them can be pretty extreme and I feel it breaks immersion somewhat (although amusing).

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Cons: It took two days to get it working and takes 30 minutes to load each time.

Pros: I finally had a decent inventory and had just tamed my first dinosaur. When some Aussie fella crashed into my camp at night, knocked out my dino, knocked out me, took all my stuff and clothes and then knocked my dino out again causing it to die from starvation while I pathetically crawled away with blurry dim vision.

I regained my vision and carefully followed the dino-murderer at a distance. I found his home base and stayed up on the cliffs out of view. Eventually dino-murderer-and-inventory-stealer went to sleep.

I broke his front door, killed him, reclaimed my items, claimed all his items then skinned him for the meat to go out and tame a new dino.

Additional pro: Heading towards a light drop when realised the dude who lives nearby (high lvl dude who doesn't like me because he caught me breaking in and taking his stuff and I got away with it) had left his 3 Argentavis (big nasty ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ birds) there on aggressive. The ♥♥♥♥ers attacked me and I jumped into the ocean with the vague hope I could get a shark to distract them and quite a lot of panic.

The first bird flew right past me and descended into the depths of the ocean, never to be seen again.

The other two perched at the edge of the underwater cliff, apparently baffled by the water and soon drowned.

I gained a decent amount of wood housing from the drop and went on my way. I notice the dude has a 4th Argentavis and I may return to repeat the experiment.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is an early access title with a heavy emphasis on multiplayer and what we should all have come to expect from that is hiccups at launch. The current issues are server populations, much needed optimizations, and a bit of lag.

Now, what you might not have expected is the incredible effort on the developers pushing out patch after patch each one having a positive  effect on preformace. I've never seen patches roll out this quickly on an EA game and it's blowing me away. The actual gameplay is awesome but the devs are a leagues above what I've come to expect from EA and I feel like with them we'll actually get a finished product and continued support.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

It's like a Mini- Dino/Survival MMORPG Game with tons of PVE/PVP aspects on a latest Unreal Engine 4's eye-candy graphics.

It's a fresh air in Survival Genre and to be honest , it's one of the most polished and updated next-gen Early Access on the market.

There are Dedicated (PVP-PVE)/Custom/Local server support along with singleplayer and multiplayer option.
Mod Support is also available.

If you like MMO and survival/crafting/building games in mix of Jurassic Park , then just hit the purchase" and enjoy.

Good Job so far  as Devs really amazed me after seeing a very polished next-gen Early Access game
